loans.name: Kanakalata

texts.en:
Kanakalata is a 38-year-old woman living with her two daughters aged 10 and 12 years and a son aged 15 . She lives in a village close to the beautiful Chilika Lake, one of the biggest lakes in Odisha.

Kanakalata got married to Madhu when she was 20 years old. Like other village folk, her husband was a fisherman who went to Chilika for fishing. Unfortunately, she lost her husband in 2009 in an accident when he went fishing. Since then she has been working hard to support her children. 

She started the business of selling fresh fish and dried fish. Drying the fish is a way of preserving the fish for future use by drying them in the sun until the water is completely evaporated. Dried fish has a storage life of several years. Dried fish is used in different delicacies as fresh fish is and is very popular in the region.

She buys fish directly from the local fishermen and sells some of them fresh and dries some of them to sell as dried fish. She purchases 10 to 12 kg of fresh fish and 18-20 kg of dried fish and sells it by roaming door to door in the nearby villages. She earns 4,000 INR per month.
 
She has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR so that she can purchase the fish in a bulk to make more dried fish and stock up during the monsoon season. There is a huge demand for dried fish during the monsoon season as not much stock is available in the market. So she can get a better price as well. 

This loan will help her to increase her working capital to run her business by increasing her revenues almost 50%, giving her 5,000 to 6,000 INR per month.
She wants to save enough to give her children a good quality of life and send them to college. She wants to see them educated and not working as fishermen.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk to make more dried fish and stock up during the monsoon season for her fish business.

loans.name: Ann Sara Akasha Self Help Group

texts.en: The group Ann Sara Akasha Self Help Group (SHG) has 10 members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing 5th from the left, wearing a red sari in the photo, is Jayanti. She is the leader of the group. Jayanti is a 40-year-old woman married to a worker in Tangi village in Odisha, India. The couple has one son who is in school. Jayanti lives with her son and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family expenses, Jayanti has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling it to the distributors for the past five years. She supplies her rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Jayanti, together with the group Ann Sara Akasha SHG, are requesting a loan from Peoples Forum to purchase fertilizers, and pesticides, seeds and to cover their operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds etc.

loans.name: Sarat Kumar

texts.en:
Sarat Kumar is a 35-year-old physically challenged person living with his wife and a son, age 16 years. His wife is a homemaker and his son is still schooling. 

He is engaged in the activity of running a small poultry farm from which he earns 5,000 INR per month.

He has an idea to enlarge his business by adding some more chicks to his poultry farm and renovating his farm house. He also wants to install a automated water supply system for giving water to chicks.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 INR for purchasing chicks, their food and medicines and for renovating his farm.
 
He has a dream to make his son well educated, give his family a good and quality life and save some money for his son's future.

loans.use: to pay for more chicks, their food and medicines, and to renovate his poultry farm.

loans.name: Nasri

texts.en:
Nasri is a 57-year-old widowed man, father of five children. He spent his whole life raising his children with special care and love to compensate them for their mother's lost tenderness.

Nasri has raised bees and river fish in his village since 32 years ago. His business is well known in the region because of the good quality of honey he produces, in addition to the fish farm he owns.

Nari is feeling lonely these days, especially since his children grew up, and each one is planning his own living. That's why Nari plans to get  married and live his life with a person with whom he can share the good and the bad days.

Nasri applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay his marriage legal fees.   He hopes to stay in good health and capable of taking good care of his business.

loans.use: To pay his marriage legal fees.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 48 years old.  She is widowed, with two children.

She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.  This is her second term loan in KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan well and in good time.

She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings and pay laborers on her farm.  She was introduced to us by one of our field officers.

She hopes to purchase another piece of farming land.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seedlings and pay laborers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and married, with four children. 

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been fattening pigs for eight years now, and she has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Linshey

texts.es:
Linshey es soltera y tiene dos hijas una de ellas esta en etapa escolar, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja en una entidad privada por más de ocho horas al día y con lo que gana debe pagar los alquileres, educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, también cuenta con los ingresos diarios de su vehiculo ya que lo hace trabajar como taxi.
El crédito lo requiere para el cambio de motor del vehiculo ya que es una fuente de ingresos diarios para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Linshey es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Linshey’s single and has two daughters; one of them is school age.  They live in a rented house occupying a single room.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.

She currently earns income as an employee in a private firm; she works more than 8 hours daily and uses her income to pay rent, school, food and basic utility costs for her family.  She also earns daily income from her vehicle that she puts to work as a taxi.

She needs the loan to replace the vehicle’s motor since it’s one of her sources of daily income to support her family.  This is the first time she’s requested financing from IMPRO and first from KIVA.

loans.use: to replace the motor in the vehicle she uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta es casada y tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos ya es independiente, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que tiene una pensión donde vente comida y recibe ingresos diarios, también cuenta con los ingresos de alquileres cada fin de mes ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital en su pensión ya que desea comprar los alimentos por cantidad para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Julieta es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida para tener más ingresos.
Es la séptima vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y  la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julieta’s married and has two children one of which is now independent.  They live in her own house occupying two bedrooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.

She currently earns income because she has a food stand and earns daily income.  She also earns rental fees at the end of each month.  She is the only one who covers her family’s food, education and basic utility costs.

She needs the loan to increase capital in her catering service; she wants to buy food in quantity to improve her income.  Julieta’s dream is to expand the business of selling food in order to earn more income.  This is her 7th loan request with IMPRO and 1st with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy food items at wholesale.

loans.name: El Inicio Group

texts.es:
El Inicio es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 7 personas, trabajadoras, alegres y amables, ellos decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo porque es el primer crédito que van a recibir de VisionFund. Este grupo se encuentra en una comunidad llamada San Agustin, en la cual su gente se dedica a la recolección de las resinas de los arboles de hule y a al cultivo de caña de azúcar.

Amelia tiene la edad de 23 años, estudio dos años de universidad y es madre soltera de un pequeño, ella platica que hace un poco mas de un año abrió un cibercafé en un pequeño local que construyó frente a su casa, ella dijo "gracias a Dios me va bien en el negocio porque solo tengo una competencia y como estoy enfrente de la escuela mas vienen para mi negocio los clientes", ella ofrece el servicio de renta de computadoras, impresiones y escáner también dijo que  piensa que la clave del éxito de su negocio se debe a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes y en algunas ocaciones enseña a sus clientes a usar las computadoras sin cobrarles. Ella invertirá este crédito en dar matenimiento a computadoras y compar de cartuchos y hojas para impresiones. Amelia desea que con esta inversión su negocio continué creciendo ya que desea dar una mejor vida a su hijo y a futuro iniciar a invertir sus ganancias en la compra de memorias usb para vender.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Margarita venta de abarrotes 
Armando venta de Hot-Dogs
Imelda venta de antojitos mexicanos
Maria del Carmen venta de perfumeria
Leonor venta de antojitos
Evelia venta de calzado
texts.en:
El Inicio (The Start) is an entrepreneurial group made up of 7 hardworking, upbeat and kind people who decided to give this name to their business in honor of their first loan from VisionFund. The group is located in the community of San Agustin, an area  in which many residents work in the rubber industry extracting pitch and rubber resin from trees. The other major industry in the region is the cultivation of sugar cane.

Amelia is 23 years old, and studied two years at a university. She is a single mother with a young son, and just over a year ago, she opened up an internet café in a small space in the front of her home. She comments that, “I thank God that business is going well, and since I am located just across the street from the school, many customers visit my café.”

Amelia offers several services to her customers, including computer access, document scanning and printing. She believes that things are going well because she is very attentive to customer needs and will even help customers learn how to use computers free of charge. She plans to use the support from this loan to repair and service some of her computers, as well as to purchase ink cartridges and reams of copy paper to restock the business. Amelia hopes that this investment will help to grow and strengthen her business, leading to an improved quality of life for her and a better future for her son. She also would like to begin selling USB flash drives at her business.

The other group members are:
Margarita, whop operates a general store.
Armando, who sells hot dogs.
Imelda, who sells traditional Mexican food.
Maria del Carmen, who sells perfume.
Leonor, who sells traditional Mexican food.
Evelia, who sells shoes.

loans.use: repair and service her computers, as well as purchase ink cartridges, reams of paper and other supplies for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Belinda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Belinda tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres y hermano menor en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Belinda es una persona muy emprendedora, se dedica a su propio negocio desde hace 2 años, vende ropa nueva y usada para damas, jeans, blusas, camisetas, short y otros como perfumes y accesorios. Además realiza trabajos contables donde genera otros ingresos. Las ventas de mercadería las realiza de forma ambulante y por pedidos. Ella quiere expandir más su mercado y está solicitando un préstamo de 8,000 Lempiras para la compra de ropa interior y blusas ya que tiene mayor demanda, y para mantener surtido su negocio lo que le permitirá incrementar los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Su meta es instalar el negocio como una tienda en un local fijo y hacer crecer más el negocio para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Belinda, 29, is single living with her parents and younger brother in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  Belinda is a very enterprising person.  She’s had her own business for two years.  She sells new and used clothes for women: jeans, blouses, t-shirts, shorts and other things like perfume and accessories.

She also works doing accounting services and earns extra income that way.  She sells from place to place and also based on prior orders.  She wants to expand her market and is asking for an 8000 Lempira loan to buy underwear and blouses that are in high demand to keep her business stocked in order to increase income to help her family.

Her goal is to set up her business as a store in a fixed locale and to make it grow more so that she can continue improving her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy underwear and blouses.

loans.name: La Escondida Group

texts.es:
El grupo La escondida se encuentra en la comunidad de San Agustín, en esta comunidad la gentes es muy trabajadora y amable, porque se encuentra ubicado a orilla de la carretera. Este grupo está integrado por 10 personas:  Raymundo venta de refrescos, Isidro venta de calzado, Lorenzo cultivo de maiz, Félix servicio de albañileria, Eugenio servicio de carpinteria, Guadalupe venta de cosmeticos, Agueda venta de zapatos, Amada venta de antojitos, Valeria venta de pasteles y Marcela venta de refrescos.

Don Eugenio tiene la edad de 46 años y es soltero, el platica que como no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar su padre le aconsejo que aprendiera a desempeñar un oficio el cual en un futuro lo ayudaría a salir adelante y tener una vida digna. Don eugenio aprendió el oficio de la carpinteria y desde hace mas de 20 años se dedica a la elaboración de muebles(mesas, sillas, roperos,camas), con el pasar de los años ha hecho buenos clientes y constantemente la gente va a buscarlo para que les elaboren sus muebles y el con gusto se los hace. El esta muy contento porque este oficio no solo le a dado la oportunidad de ganar dinero sino de conocer gente y hacer buenos amigos. Este crédito le dará la oportunidad de comprar madera para continuar realizando su actividad. El dijo "gracias por la oportunidad que nos dan con estos créditos de mejorar los negocios y las vidas de nuestras familias." El desea a futuro obtener buenas ganancias para poder dar mantenimiento a sus herramientas electricas.
texts.en:
The “La Escondida” (The Hidden One) group is from the community of San Agustín.  People in this community are very hardworking and kind because it’s found alongside a highway.  The group has ten members: Raymundo sells soft-drinks, Isidro sells shoes, Lorenzo grows corn, Félix works in construction, Eugenio is a carpenter, Guadalupe sells cosmetics, Águeda sells shoes, Amanda sells fast-food snacks, Valeria sells cakes and Marcela sells soft-drinks.

Eugenio is 46-years-old, single and relates that since he did not have the opportunity to attend school his father advised him to learn an occupation that in the future would make it possible for him to get ahead and live with dignity.  Eugenio learned carpentry and for more than 20 years now has been manufacturing furniture (tables, chairs, armoires and beds).  As time has gone by, he’s acquired very good customers and people come looking for him constantly so that he’ll make furniture for them and he does so gladly.

Presently, he’s very happy because this occupation has not only given him the wherewithal to earn money but also has led to his getting to know people and to establish good friendships with them.  With this loan he will be able to buy lumber to continue with his activity.

He said: “Thank you for the opportunity you give us with these loans to improve our businesses and our family’s lives.”  In future, he wants to earn good profits so that he can service his electric tools.

loans.use: to buy lumber to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: Bernadina

texts.en:
Bernadina works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Bernadina is requesting a loan of PHP 18,500 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to her customers.  She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Bernadina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Una Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Don Efrain tiene 46 años de edad el se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos y hamburguesas dice que el se siente muy orgulloso de pertenecer a su grupo llamado Una Nueva Esperanza, dice que el pone su negocio en las fiestas populares de los pueblos aledaños a su población y que le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le quedan muy sabrosas las hamburguesas las papas fritas, los chicharrones preparados etc. Dice que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de los insumos que le hacen falta para hacer sus antojitos y que los compra en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a la de el. Los otros cinco integrantes del grupo son Maria Magdalena, Ma Victoria, Leticia, Petra y Francisco ellos invertirán en su negocio de abarrotes, paletería y refrescos, panadería y elaboración de quesos.
texts.en: Efrain is 46 years old and sells Mexican snacks and hamburgers.  He tells us that he is very proud to belong to the group called “Una Nueva Esperanza” (A New Hope) and says that he sets up his business during popular festivals in adjacent towns and that he likes what he does very much.  His hamburgers, fries, and chicharones are delicious.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies that he needs to make his snacks.  He buys [his supplies] in different stores in a nearby town.  The other five members are Maria Magdalena, Ma Victoria, Leticia, Petra, and Francisco.  They will invest in their grocery store business, frozen treat and soft drink business, bakery, and cheese making business.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro de 74 años de edad es casado y aun que tiene hijos ya ninguno depende de él económicamente. Pedro sabe que tiene que brindarle a su esposa una buena casa debido a que ambos son de edad ya avanzada y son más propensos a las enfermedades. En esta ocasión Pedro quiere reconstruir el techo en la parte de atrás de su domicilio. El agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Pedro, 74, is married and although he does have children none of them depend on him economically anymore.  Pedro knows that he must provide his wife with a good house because they are both advanced in age and more prone to getting sick.  On this occasion, Pedro wants to rebuild the roof on the rear of his house.  He will be grateful for any help he can get.

loans.use: to rebuild the roof.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina  anteriormente ha tenido crédito con KIVA el cual ha sido para realizar mejoras a su vivienda. Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la construcción de una losa al frente de su casa.
La señora Alejandrina es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas que ya son mayores de edad y quienes le ayudan con los gastos de la casa. La señora Alejandrina actualmente trabaja en limpieza de una casa particular, este ingreso será para pagar el crédito y que los ingresos que obtienen sus hijas serán para los gastos de la familia.
Desean mejorar su vivienda y que este mas segura ya que trabajan todo el día.
texts.en:
Alejandrina has had KIVA financing in the past that she used for home improvements.  She’s once again asking for a loan to lay a concrete slab in front of her house. 

Alejandrina is a single mother; she has two daughters who are already adults and who help her with household expenses.  Alejandrina currently works as a cleaning lady in a private home.  She will use income from this job to repay the loan since the income her daughters earn will be used for family expense.  They want to improve their home so that it will be more secure since they are away at work all day.

loans.use: to lay a concrete slab.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lilia works hard to support her family.  She has a used clothing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income by selling dried fish and farming sugarcane and corn.  Lilia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 62 years old, married, and has four children. Erlinda is in the agricultural business: she raises pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Erlinda has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Erlinda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en: Ma. Nilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store (variety store) in the Philippines. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. NWTF is relisting Ma. Nilda's business profile again, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Everardo

texts.es: El joven Everardo de 26 años de edad es soltero y no tiene dependientes económicos. El esta trabajando en una de las maquiladoras de la localidad en el turno de dia, sabe que es importante tener un buen hogar en orden para sentirse mas seguro. En esta ocasión Everardo esta solicitando de nuestra ayuda porque quiere construir una barda en su domicilio ell agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Everardo, 26, is a single young man with no economic dependents.  He’s working the day shift at a local assembly plant.  He knows that’s important to have a house that’s in order so that he can feel more secure.  On this occasion, Everardo is asking for help because he wants to erect a wall at home.  He will be grateful for any help he can be given.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Jorge Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Jorge esta solicitando este crédito para hacer una ampliación a su vivienda, ya que desea construir un cuarto así sus hijas tengan su espacio pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para llevar acabo esta mejora por lo que solicita el préstamo.
El señor Jorge tiene su propio negocio que poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer ahora ya tiene un local establecido de vulcanizadora donde realiza los trabajos con mayor comodidad y puede dar un mejor servicio a sus cliente de reparación de llantas para los autos.
Con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio será para pagar el crédito, ya que su esposa se dedica al cuidado y atención de sus hijas.
Quiere brindara comodidad así como privacidad para los integrantes de la familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is requesting this loan to enlarge his house because he wants to add a bedroom so that his daughters will have their own space but he does not have enough money to do so which is why he’s asking for the loan.

Jorge has his own business which has gradually been growing.  He now has a tire repair shop where he can do his work more comfortably and provide better tire repair services to his customers.  He will use profits from this business to repay the loan since his wife takes care of their daughters.  He wants to provide comfort as well as privacy for all members of his family.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Bertha Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Bertha tiene mas de 20 años dedicándose a la preparación y ventas de comidas mexicanas, cuenta con un pequeño negocio con el cual se a desempeñado exitosamente, en el trabaja ella y su esposo quien le ayuda atender a los clientes.
Solicitan el préstamo para la compra de una plancha más amplia para cocinar, ya que la que tiene actualmente es muy chica y se le complica mucho la preparación de los alimentos.
Desea mejorar la calidad del servicio del negocio y teniendo una plancha más grande podrá preparar los comidas mas rápido y sin problema y así su clientes estarán mas satisfechos les brindaran un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Bertha has been working for more than 20 years cooking traditional Mexican dishes to sell; she has a small business that’s developed successfully.  She works there and so does her husband who helps take care of customers.

They are requesting a loan to buy a bigger griddle to cook on because the one she has now is too small and cooking on it is complicated.  She wants to improve service in the business and having a larger griddle will allow her to prepare the food more quickly and problem-free so that her customers will be more satisfied because they are getting better service.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en: Renilda is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. Renilda works very hard to provide for them. Renilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Renilda has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soap, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. In the future Renilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosena

texts.en:
Rosena is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells scrap materials in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Rosena earns additional income from a general store and from raising pigs.

Rosena is requesting a loan for  21,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to purchase more scrap materials to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is married and has eight children who live separately.  She lives in San Roque. She still generates an income for her family's sustenance and does not only rely on her children's contributions. 

Adelina and her husband are involved in hauling junk and other recyclable materials and reselling for a profit. They earn 10,000 PHP each month. Though it was quite difficult to be involved in this kind of business they patiently operates it for their income. 

Adelina is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more junk products such as old newspapers, bottles, and metals to resell. She hopes to save funds to use in times of emergencies as she and her husband are getting older.

loans.use: to purchase old newspapers, bottles, and metals to sell.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадине 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает в организации, а она сама уже второй год работает в МЗО Имон Интернешенл. Она является одной из успешных работников. У нее очень хорошие и умные дети. Ее младшая дочь Зарнигор в этом году поступила в Худжанский Государственный Университет в факультет Иностранных языков. Зарплата Мадины и ее мужа не хватает оплатить за учебы дочери. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 525 долларов США для оплаты учебы дочери в университете. Мадина и Зарнигор ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Madina is 39 years old. She is married and is raising 3 children. Her husband works with the organization IMON International, and Madina has also been working there for the past two years. Madina is one of its most successful employees.

Madina's children are bright and good kids. This year her youngest daughter Zarnigor began studying at the Khujand State University in the Faculty of Foreign Languages.

The salaries of Madina and her husband are not sufficient to cover their daughter's education expenses. Madina is seeking a loan in the amount of 525 US dollars to pay the cost of her daughter's university.

Madina and Zarnigor are grateful for the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for daughter’s study at the university

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo es soltero y tiene dos hijos, vive en una casa como cuidador ocupando solo una habitación, sus dos hijos están en etapa escolar, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer en el área urbana por más de doce horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia. También trabaja los fines de semana como cerrajero ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital comprando herramientas para su cerrajería ya que desea ampliar su taller.
El sueño de Alejo, es adquirir una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y  KIVA.
texts.en:
Alejo’s single and has two children.  He lives in a house as a caretaker occupying a single room.  His two children are school age and the house is located in the city of El Alto’s Río Seco zone.

He currently works as a driver in the urban zone for more than twelve hours daily well into the night since he’s the only one who covers food, school and basic utility costs for his family.  On weekends he also works as a locksmith in order to improve his income.

He needs the loan to increase capital purchasing tools for his metal shop because he wants to expand it.  Alejo’s dream is to get a house under the ‘anticrético ‘ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to provide his family with more comfort.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell to customers. NWTF is listing Analyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 62 years old and married with 10 children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to pay her sugarcane laborers' salaries. Virginia has been farming sugarcane for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay sugarcane laborers' salaries

loans.name: Saraswati Group

texts.en:
The group named Saraswati (the name of a Hindu goddess of Education) consists of five active women entrepreneurs named Kamala, Indra, Sasidei, Sasi and Rukmani. They are from Duajhar village under Nuapada district in Odisha, India and started a new venture to contribute to their family income by forming a group in the year 2012. The featured member, Kamala, is sitting in the middle raising her hand in the photo. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband, one son age 16 and one daughter age 13. Kamala is a very energetic and hard working lady. She has been running a cloth weaving unit in her house for the last 25 years. Now she is managing her business successfully with three weaving units. In two units, she is weaving saris and in one unit gamchha (towels). Kamala has engaged three skilled laborers to help her with the weaving. They produce three saris and three towels per day. Kamala pays Rs 100/- per sari and Rs 50/- per towel as labor charges to the weavers. Her husband brings raw materials (yarn/thread per unit costs around 10,000/-) from a stockist in a nearby town on credit and gives the finished products to the same stockiest who does not give as much return to her compared to her efforts. Therefore,  she is running at a continuous loss and facing a lot of trouble maintaining her family.  So she is planning to use the entire loan to purchase more stock of raw materials like yarn. This will help her to eliminate some unnecessary expenses resulting from frequent movements to bring in raw materials. The role of Kamala in the business is to process the thread. Sometimes her daughter also helps her in this processing work. Kamala hopes to repair her house and wants to purchase some assets for the marriage of her daughter. 

Indra, Sasidei, Rukmani and Sasi are the other four members. They are running a medicine store, a cloth business, a utensils business and atailoring business, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase yarn/thread for weaving

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ELISA TIENE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TIENE TRES HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ESTUDIÓ SÓLO LA PRIMARIA.  VIVE EN LA ZONA LECHERA DE LA TAMBORADA "B" A NUEVE KILÓMETROS DE LA CIUDAD, ELLA TRABAJA CON GANADO LECHERO, ENTREGA LECHE A LA PLANTA INDUSTRIALIZADORA Y TAMBIÉN A PERSONA PARTICULAR DE LA ZONA PARA LA ELABORACIÓN DE QUESILLOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN LA CONFECCIÓN DE COLCHONES, PERO NO ES UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE GENERE INGRESOS SEGUROS PARA EL SUSTENTO FAMILIAR.   ESTÁN MEJORANDO SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA Y YA TIENEN UNA CASITA A MEDIO CONSTRUIR, LES FALTA MUCHO EN OBRA FINA, PERO ESTÁN CONTENTOS PORQUE LOS HIJOS YA TIENEN SU PROPIO ESPACIO.  NECESITA EL CRÉDITO PARA EL FORRAJE Y TIENEN QUE ABASTECERSE PARA LA PRODUCCIÓN DE LECHE.  SU COMPRA SERÁ DE CÁSCARA DE SOYA Y BOLSAS CON ALIMENTO BALANCEADO, PRODUCTOS INDISPENSABLE PARA LA ALIMENTACIÓN Y MEJORAMIENTO DEL GANADO LECHERO.
texts.en: Elisa is 36 years old and has 3 school-aged children. She only studied through primary school. She lives in dairy zone "Tamborada B" 9 kilometers from the city. She works with dairy cows. She brings milk to the industrial plant and also to a particular person in the area for the making of cheese. Her husband works in the making of mattresses, but it is not an job that generates steady income to sustain the family. They are improving their living conditions and they have a small house being constructed, and is far from finished, but they are happy because the children already have their own space. She needs a loan for plant feed and they have to stock up for the production of milk. Her purchase will be of soybean nuts and bags of balanced food, indispensable products for the feeding and developing of the milk cows.

loans.use: to buy forage, soybean nuts, and balanced food for cows.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура очень способная и талантливая женщина. Ей 19 лет, замужем и студентка 2-го курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Она успешно справляется и с учебой и семьей. Манзура кроме учебы еще занимается шитьем женской одежды. Так как Манзура шьет очень красивые платья, так и многие женщины являются ее клиентками. Ее муж тоже учится в университете и не в состоянии оплатить за учебу Манзуры. Манзура запрашивает кредит на сумму 750 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Она надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Manzura is a very capable and talented woman. She is 19 years old, married, and is in her 2nd year of studies at the Tajikistan Sate University of Commerce. 

Manzura very successfully balances her studies and her family life. In addition to studying at the university, Manzura sews women's clothing. Because she makes very beautiful dresses, she has a large clientele. 

Manzura's husband is also a university student and so is not in a position to be able to cover her educational costs. Manzura is seeking a loan in the amount of 750 US dollars to pay for university.

Manzura is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To pay for study at the university

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es: Deyanira de 31 años de edad,  vive en un municipio artesanal de la Costa Caribe, muy cerca a la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias. Su vida transcurre entre su trabajo en su tienda  y su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Deyanira desde hace 2 años se dedicó a la actividad comercial,  vendiendo mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos,  como ropa, calzado y cosméticos, actividad con la que le fue muy bien y logró agregar ingresos a su hogar, además de enseñarle su oficio de comerciante. Cuando se mudó cerca a la carretera troncal en su pueblo, percibió el peligro que corrían los habitantes del pueblo al cruzar esa vía, al comprar  diariamente sus víveres y los artículos de la canasta familiar que en su familia consumen. Este hecho le dio la idea de adicionar a sus ingresos un nuevo negocio,  que fue el montaje de su propia tienda para venderles también, artículos que sus vecinos requerían, como lo que hoy hace al comercializar productos de primera necesidad, ranchos, víveres, refrescos, lácteos etc., ropa  y calzado. Con su negocio ha visto el progreso desde su propia casa al generar ingresos; su proyecto futuro es hacer crecer  su tienda para aumentar los ingresos de su familia. Deyanira realiza sus  ventas diariamente y de contado principalmente, mientras sus compras las realiza una parte a crédito y otra parte  de contado.  Ella tiene un gran desafío que superar y es el de no tener, muchas veces,  los productos que sus clientes necesitan, por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a su primer credikiva con el cual comprará víveres que rotan fácilmente como arroz, azúcar, aceite, lácteos, enlatados y refrescos.   Con esta inversión proyecta mejorar sus ventas con más artículos y aumentar el número de sus clientes fijos. Su meta es mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y terminar sus estudios, lo cual le significa también un gran desafío personal.
texts.en:
Deyanira, 31, lives in the artisanal community of Costa Caribe very near the city of Cartagena de Indias.  Her life unfolds between her store and her family composed of her spouse and six-year-old son.  Deyanira has been a merchant for two years;  she started selling merchandise like clothes, shoes and cosmetics via specialized catalogues .  She did very well with this activity and was able to contribute income to her home in addition to learning how to be a merchant.

When she relocated near her town’s main highway she realized that residents in the town exposed themselves to danger crossing that highway to buy basic staple items their families consume every day.    This gave her an idea for a way to increase her income with a new business which was to open a store of her own to sell products to her neighbors that they needed and has been doing so to date; she sells basic staple items, snacks, foodstuffs, soft-drinks, dairy products, clothes and footwear, etc.  With her business she’s seen her home improve as she’s generated income.  Her future project is to make the store bigger thus increasing family income even more.  

Deyanira sells every day and mostly for cash while her purchases are partly on credit and partly cash.  She has a great challenge to overcome which is that often she does not have everything her customers need in stock which is why she’s calling on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for her first KIVA loan to buy the items that sell the most like rice, sugar, oil, dairy products, canned goods and soft-drinks.  With this investment, she’s anticipating improved sales with more merchandise and an increase in the number of her regular customers.  Her goal is to make home improvements and to finish her studies, another great personal challenge.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Yobana, ella tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, nació en Urubamba pero vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta del Cusco – Perú. La actividad económica principal de la socia es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, la cual queda en su propio domicilio. Yobana trabaja en su comercio hace más o menos un año, y es con esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia.
Yobana está haciendo crecer su actividad, por ello necesita capitalizarla y comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche etc. 
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Yobana, 29, is married and has two children.  She was born in Urubamba but lives in Tambo Real District in Anta del Cusco Province, Peru.  Her main economic activity is selling basic staple items in her grocery store located at home.  Yobana has been in business for about a year more or less and is able to support her family by means of this business.

Yobana is making the store grow and needs to capitalize it and buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, etc.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop in this activity and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marjolyn

texts.en:
Marjolyn is a single mother who has a young child to sustain. She sells meat sausages, pork sausages, and hot dogs to the people in her village. She buys these meat products at the public market and re-sells them for profit. Her income goes toward food. She is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP  to buy more hot dogs, pork sausages, and meat sausages to sell. This will help increase sales and thus generate higher income. 

Someday, with enough funds, Marjolyn will start a direct selling business (cosmetics and home products) for an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy more hot dogs, pork sausages, and meat sausages.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has run a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for the past five years. She earns additional income from food vending, and has been sustaining her business activities through her own hard work and with the help of loans from NWTF. Eva is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare motorcycle parts to maintain her motorcycle. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a store owner in Bagumbayan. She has been selling grocery items to the people in her village for more than four years now. She did not finish college and only manages a store. She usually gains about PHP 4,000 each month and uses it to pay for her younger sisters' school fees. Elma is 51 and single. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles to sell in her store. 

This will help increase her sales and income, too.
 
In the future, Elma hopes to have a stable income so she can help educate some other members of her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles to sell in her store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy more clothing items to sell.

NWTF is relisting Evangeline's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing items to sell in her business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina produces charcoal for sale at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for some years now. Faustina is married to a farmer, and has 5 children. Her income supplements that of her husband's to feed the family and pay the children’s school fees. Faustina will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce the charcoal to sell. With the profit from her expanded business, Faustina will produce a large quantity of the charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
A determined mother and a loving wife, Wilma has four children and is married to Guillermo, her partner in managing their small store and food stall business. In their businesses for over 10 years now, they use the income earned to provide meals and allowances for their children.

Wilma is now requesting additional capital of P5,000 to buy eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, and soft drinks to sell. She hopes this loan will be granted so she can increase her inventory and continue offering good products and friendly service.

loans.use: to buy eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
From the community of Trinidad, Bohol, Mario is 26 years old, married, and the father of two children, ages four and six. Mario, a farmer who has been growing rice for five years now, is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings that will sustain the needs of his farm. His profit from the harvest will provide his family with a healthy diet and pay for electricity.

Mario dreams of having a comfortable life for his family, and also hopes that in the future he can give his children a good education. He plans to have a bigger farm to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es: La señora silvana es una persona mayor de edad, tiene su esposo pero tiene el deseo de superación por si misma y dar apoyo a la familia, entonces por si sola se dedico al comercio de la compra venta de zapatos y que entrega de acuerdo a los pedidos, así fue superándose, pese al obstáculo que tiene su hija que estudia en la escuela y tiene que facilitar en la compra de materiales de estudio y vestimenta, en la actualidad la señora Silvana no tiene casa ni lote de terreno, con lo poco de trabajo en el comercio tuvo ahorro que con el mismo pudo conseguir una casa en anticrético compartido con su hermano, antiguamente la Sra.: Silvana fue chofer que se dedicaba al transporte publico como taxista, accidentalmente sufrió un choque de Vehículo el cual le dejo sin herramienta de trabajo y por lo tanto se encuentra en proceso de superación y requiere de financiamiento. La convivencia con su esposo no es tan clara la relación de unión familiar, el cual muestra el total desinterés de tener apoyo de su esposo en su trabajo y la colaboración económica de su esposo.
texts.en:
Silvana is an adult.  She has her husband but also a strong desire for self-improvement and to support her family.  Because of this, she started a business on her own selling shoes on prior order.  She gradually improved  despite the obstacle she has of her daughter being in school and having to provide her with school supplies and uniforms.  

Silvana owns neither a house nor land but with her work in commerce was able to get a house under the anticrético modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] that shared with her brother.

Silvana used to work as a taxi driver providing public transportation service but she had collision that left her without a work tool so she’s now in the process of overcoming this and needs financing.

Her living relationship with her husband isn’t very clear; she has no interest whatsoever in having his support at work nor economic collaboration from him.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Senobio

texts.es: El Señor Senobio tiene 29 años de edad vive en la zona de Valle Hermoso en el municipio de Chimoré del departamento de Cochabamba es agricultor y vive del trabajo de su producción de cultivos de cítricos y como trabajo jornal diario en diferentes chacos del lugar. Senobio es una persona sencilla y siempre estuvo acostumbrado a la labor del campo, se concubino y fruto de eso tuvo cinco hijos que mantener, desde muy pequeño se dedico a trabajar ya que su familia de escasos recursos económicos y tuvo que subsistir casi sin la ayuda de sus padres, siendo joven sufrió mucho por su poca actitud de dirigirse a las personas por su timidez que no le deja sobresalir entre los demás sumados a esto la poca costumbre de convivir con los demás le llevaron a adquirir muy poco para su subsistencia y cuando logro tener familia empezó a trabajar mas arduamente, ahora con el apoyo que le brindara los créditos Kiva podrá invertir en un capital de verduras para que su pareja también trabaje y así pueden tener mas medios para poder sustentar los gastos de la familia que poco apoco va creciendo, vive con mas ánimos y se dedica a cuidar y brindar lo mejor que pueda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Senobio, 29, lives in the Valle Hermoso zone in the municipality of Chimoré in Cochabamba Department.  He’s a farmer and works growing citrus fruit and also works as a day laborer in various fields nearby.

Senobio is an unassuming person who has always worked in the fields.  He started living with someone and they now has five children to support.  He’s worked hard since he was very little because his family had limited resources and he had to survive with almost no support from his parents.  

While young, he suffered much because of his shyness in approaching others; it kept him from standing out among others and when this was added to his little experience in being around other people he was able to barely eke out an existence.  When he got his own family, though, he started working harder and now with support from Kiva loans he can invest capital in buying  vegetables so that his spouse can also work and they will have the means to cover family expenses which gradually increase.  He’s now more encouraged and is dedicated to caring for and providing his children with the very best he can.

loans.use: to buy corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor pablo es una persona mayor de edad de 42 años, actualmente el cliente tiene muchas ganas, el deseo de superarse a sí mismo y dar todo el apoyo que sea posible a la familia, ya que es casado y tiene una hija que estudia en colegio y los gastos cada vez son mayores, entonces por si solo se dedico al trabajo de albañil durante casi toda su vida y poco a poco con los ahorros sobrevive y con mucho esfuerzo ya fue construyendo su casita para vivir en mejores condiciones, por lo tanto ahora para terminar de construir lo que siempre tuvo en su pensamiento necesita material de construccion para terminarlo su casita, así fue superándose, pese a los obstáculos que siempre atraviesa uno en la vida, la familia se encuentra muy unida y con muchas ganas de superarse entre si el cual muestra el total interés de tener apoyo. El cliente es muy trabajador.
texts.en: Pablo’s a 42-year-old adult.  He very much wants to improve and give all the support possible to his family since he’s married and has a daughter attending school and expenses are higher every day.  He decided on his own to work in construction and has done so most of his life.  He’s able to survive with his savings and with much effort has been gradually building his house in order to live in better conditions.  Now, in order to finish building what he’s always thought of he needs building materials and supplies to finish the house.  He’s gradually improved despite obstacles one faces in life.  His family is very united and very much want to improve among themselves; he’s very interested in getting support; he is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married and has four children, three of whom attend school.  She lives in Pengue. She and her husband manage a motorcycle transport business, which they have been dong for almost 10 years.  They earn 300 PHP a day, which pays for their meals and daily allowances for their children. 

Rosita is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy gasoline and crude oil for her transport business. She hopes her husband will continue to provide safe travel for all his passengers and generate more income from the business. The couple's main goal is to give the best education to their children up to college so they earn  degrees for better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and crude oil.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Lidia es una persona de condición humilde, descendiente de una familia de muy bajos recursos económicos, la prosperidad no estuvo de su lado, es decir no le acompaño, busco trabajo por todos los lados, finalmente encontró un empleo hace 9 años como secretaria en la Notaria de fe pública de Challapata, los ingresos obtenidos por ese servicio solo le solventan sus costos de vida, es decir para la manutención de su familia, actualmente busca mejorar su calidad y nivel de vida,ella necesita material de construccion para seguir emprendiendo la construcción de su propia vivienda en un lote pequeño que adquirió hace años con los pocos recursos que obtuvo, actualmente no cuenta con su propio inmueble, vive en el domicilio de su señor padre. Si bien los ingresos que perciben no son grandes, pero logra cubrir los costos de vida y proyectados. En entrevista con la solicitante su mayor sueño es tener su propio inmueble, concluido ese sueño, sucesivamente tiene proyectado realizar un negocio propio y así sucesivamente ir creciendo gradualmente.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in very humble conditions.  She comes from a family with very limited economic resources.  Prosperity was not on her side, that is, it did not accompany her.  She looked for work everywhere and finally got a job nine years ago as a secretary in the Callapata Notary Public.  Income earned in this job allows her to cover basic living costs, that is, to feed her family.  She’s hoping to improve her quality of life and needs building materials and supplies to continue building her house on a small lot she bought years ago with the few resources she obtained.  She currently does not own a house; she lives with her father.


Even though the income they earn isn’t much it does suffice to cover life’s current and future expenses.  When she was interviewed she said her greatest dream is to have a house of her own and when that dream is a reality to have a business of her own and gradually, successively grow.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to finish her house.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Susana, ella tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real, La actividad económica principal de la socia es la Ganadería, principalmente  la venta de leche de vaca. Susana posee 5 vacas, y es con esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia.
Susana necesita producir más leche para cubrir con la demanda de sus clientes, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar 3 vacas lecheras más. 
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Susana pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Susana, 52, is married and has four children.  She lives in Tambo Real District.  Her main economic activity is working with cattle, especially selling cow’s milk.  Susana owns five cows and supports her family by means of this work.   Susana needs to increase milk production to meet customer demand so will invest her loan in the purchase of three more dairy cows.

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop in her activity and commits to make her payments.  Susana belongs to the “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” communal bank in Anta Province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: María Esther de 36 años de edad vive en Bolivia, estudio hasta poder culminar su carrera  de magisterio, es divorciada de lo cual tiene un hijo pequeño que ella le mantiene sola, María Esther trabaja toda la semana para poder mantener a su hijo, ella también se dedica a la fabricación de bisutería manual que ella lo hace para poder generar un poco mas de ingresos el sueldo que percibe no le alcanza así es que busca sus modos para poder generar ingresos de donde puede. El presente crédito que solicita es para la compra de material de bisutería, necesita un poco de capital para poder seguir con su trabajo de bisutería así poder generar un poco mas de ingresos y tener una vida estable ya que ella no cuenta con apoyo de su ex esposo para su alimentación de su hijo, así que María Esther sale a delante para mantener a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Esther, 36, lives in Bolivia.  She completed her studies to become a teacher.  She’s divorced and has a small boy she supports by herself.  María Esther works all week in order to support her son.  She also makes costume jewelry to earn extra money to add to her salary because it’s insufficient and she’s always looking for ways to generate more income any way she can.

The present loan she’s requesting is to buy costume jewelry making supplies.  She needs a little capital to be able to continue with her costume jewelry work and generating extra income to have a stable life because she gets no help from her ex-husband to feed her son so María Esther moves forward to support her son.
.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry making supplies.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Santusa, ella tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real, La actividad económica principal de la socia es la Ganadería, principalmente  la elaboración de productos lácteos como yogurt y queso, además de esto, ella también se dedica a la compra y venta de granos como maíz y trigo. La señora Santusa a sabido aprender muy bien esta actividad y es con esta que saca adelante a toda su familia.
Santusa necesita producir más leche para la fabricación de sus producto, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar 2 vacas lecheras más y algunos sacos de granos para su comercialización. 
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Santusa pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Santusa quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, asi que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en su educación.
texts.en:
Santusa, 29, is married and has four children.  She lives in Tambo Real District.  Her main economic activity is cattle, especially producing dairy products like yoghurt and cheese.  In addition to this she also is a merchant selling grain like corn and wheat.  Santusa has learned these activities very well and supports her family this way.  Santusa needs to increase milk production to make her products and will use the loan to buy two more dairy cows and some sacks of grain to sell. 

She’s very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop in her activity and commits to make her payments.  Santusa belongs to the “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” communal bank in Anta Province in Cusco, Peru.

Santusa wants to provide her children with a better life and education and she sacrifices for them.  She intends to work much in order to save up to invest in their education.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and sacks of grain.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Oropesa y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació.  Su principal actividad económica de la socia Alejandrina sigue siendo la elaboración y venta de panes “Chuta”, ella sigue teniendo su propio horno donde prepara panes “Chutas”. (El pan CHUTA es un típico pan de la ciudad del cusco, caracterizado por ser un pan gigante que mide aproximadamente unos 30 x30 cm y 4 a 4 cm de grueso y por ser un pan muy delicioso, tanto así que muchos turistas gustan llevar una muestra a sus familiares como obsequio, a fin de que puedan estos saborear un poquito de la magia que envuelve a la ciudad imperial del cusco.)

En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo manteca,  sacos de harina, levadura, sacos de azúcar y muchas cosas más.  

Alejandrina sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 52 years old, is married and fruit of this beautiful relationship has five children. She was born in the city of Oropesa and lives in the same city where she was born. The main activity of Alejandrina it's still the making and selling of "Chuta" bread. She has her own oven where she prepares "Chuta" breads. 

Chuta Bread is bread that is particular to the city of Cusco. It is characterized for being a giant bread measuring approximately 30cm x 30cm and 4cm thick. It's delicious bread, so much that many tourists like to take samples of it as gifts for their relatives so they can taste a bit of the magic that enfolds the imperial city of Cusco. 

This time, Alejandrina needs a loan to buy supplies such as butter, sacks of flour, yeast, sugar bags, and much more.

Alejandrina still belongs to the communal bank "Ricchariy Puririsun", from Asociación Arariwa. She is very grateful for the opportunity provided and she is also committed to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy butter, sacks of flour, yeast, sugar bags and much more.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is 43 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin. She's married and a mother of four children. Rosana manage a retail business for a living. She has been engaged in this business for 26 years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP from this activity. She has requested a loan of 35,500 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Rosana been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Rosana hopes to gain more income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El socio es el señor José, el tiene 42 años de edad, está casado y tiene 4 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real, La actividad económica principal del socio es la Ganadería, principalmente  la venta de leche de vaca, además de esto, el también se dedica al transporte público interprovincial en su carro. El socio José trabaja hace muchos años en esta actividad y es con esta que saca adelante a toda su familia.
José necesita dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, por ello invertirá su préstamo en la reparación del mismo. 
José está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo a desarrollarse en sus actividades y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. José pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Jose is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. He lives in the District of Tambo Real. His principal economic activity is cattle raising, mainly for selling milk. In addition to this, Jose works in inter-provincial transportation, using his own car. He has worked in this activity for many years and it is with these efforts that he advances his family.

Jose needs to do maintenance work on his vehicle; his loan will be used to carry out these repairs. 

Jose is very grateful to Kiva for assisting in the development of his activities, and he promises to comply with his schedule of payments. Jose belongs to the “San Bartolo de Tambo Real" Communal Bank in the District of Tambo Real, Province of Anta, in Cusco.

loans.use: perform maintenance on the vehicle he drives to earn part of his income.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline  is 41 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. She also runs a grocery store on the side to supplement her income. She is a married mother of four children. She has been running her business for the past six years with great success. 

Jackline is requesting for her fourth business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. 


She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a well-known business

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
A 43-year-old single mother of three, Peris has operated her clothing sales business in the town of Nakuru for the last 13 years. She was introduced to KADET by an existing client.

This is her second business loan. She paid her previous loan well and in good time.She will use the loan amount to purchase more school uniforms, sweaters and shirts to meet growing demand due to the fact that most schools in the region are beginning new terms.

She hopes to open a wholesale shop and a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of school uniforms, sweaters and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Loikjon

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Лоикджон,  не отвечает стандартам жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Ему 30  лет, женат на прекрасной женщине, которую зовут Мархабо и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Детям  3 и 7 лет. Старший ребенок учится в школе. Мархабо домохозяйка и поэтому Лоикджон является единственным кормильцем в семье. Более 5 лет он занимается услугами таксиста и имеет много клиентов, но его доход не позволяет ему отремонтировать дом. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов. Лоикджон и его дети  ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: The house where Loikjon lives does not meet living standards and he urgently needs to renovate his house. He is 30 years old and is married to a wonderful woman named Markhabo. They are raising two children who are 3 and 7 years old. Their eldest child attends primary school. Markhabo is a homemaker and therefore Loikjon is the only wage earner in the family. For more than 5 years, he has worked as a taxi driver and has many clients, but his earnings do not permit him to renovate his house. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 USD for the purchase of building materials. Loikjon and his children await your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement for repairing his house

loans.name: Juan Raul

texts.es:
Juan Raúl tiene 50  años de edad y es casado fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, él nació en la ciudad de San Pablo de la provincia de Canchis del departamento del Cusco pero vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú.
 
Juan Raúl sigue haciendo el  servicio de transporte en su propio taxi, el cubre la ruta que va de la ciudad de Oropesa  a la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Juan Raúl requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro o sea va comprar llantas nuevas.
 
Juan Raúl sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan Raúl, 50 years old, is married and has five children. He was born in the city of San Pablo, Canchis province, Cusco department. He currently lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.

Juan Raúl continues to provide transportation services in his own taxi. He covers the route that goes from the city of Oropesa to the city of Cusco. Juan Raúl currently needs a loan for vehicle maintenance on his car. He plans on buying new tires.

Juan Raúl belongs to the Ricchariy Puririsun communal bank, part of the Arariwa Association. He is grateful for the opportunity given to him through this group so he promises to make all of his payments by the due dates.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 53-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is a fish vendor since her husband is a fisherman. She is also engaged in a rice farming business.

Luciana is asking for a loan worth 12,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, hooks and fuel for the fishing boat and fertilizer for the crops. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch and thus allow them to sell more fish in the market. Moreover, they can improve their yield from farming.

In the future, Luciana has hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and fuel for the fishing boat and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: María Benilda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Balzar se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia San Placido del cantón Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora, en su gran mayoría dedicada a las faenas del campo.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, tres mayores de edad y tres de 16, 14 y 10 años  que estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es albañil.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que al ver que su esposo no tiene un trabajo fijo y seguro desde hace siete años se hizo cargo del bar de una escuela de la localidad,  en ese lugar ofrece alimentos nutritivos y saludables preparados por ella y también frutas para los niños que acuden a este plantel,  trabaja de lunes a viernes en este lugar por el cual  ella le paga un mensualidad a la escuela por el arriendo de este bar.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Balzar communal bank meets bimonthly in the San Placido parish, Portoviejo canton. This area is known for its kind and hard-working people who mostly work in the fields, tending to the land.

María, 42 years old, lives here. She is in a common law marriage, from which she has six children. Three of them are adults and the others are 16, 14, and 10 years old and go to school. Her husband is a builder.

She is a very good homemaker. When she saw that her husband did not have permanent and regular work, she decided to take over a cafe in one of the local schools seven years ago. Here, they offer nutritional and healthy food that María prepares in addition to fruit for the children who come to the school. She works Monday through Friday and pays the school monthly for renting out the cafe.

María will use this loan to buy fruits and supplies to prepare food. She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes the help that the institution provides.

Her goals are to continue forward with her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy fruit and supplies

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La socia Raquel sigue perteneciendo  al banco comunal “Ricchariy Puririsun” de la Asociación Arariwa.  La socia Raquel sigue dedicándose  a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, ella sigue teniendo su galpón en su domicilio, ella sigue vendiendo  la carne de los cuyes porque es muy suave y por supuesto que rico en proteínas. Ya son varios  años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Además, ella vende leche en forma ambulatoria. 

La socia Raquel en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes. 

La socia Raquel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Raquel continues to belong to the “Ricchariy Puriirisun” communal bank, which is part of the Asociación Araiwa.  She continues raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs.  She still has a pen at her house.  She continues to sell the guinea pig meat because it is very tender and rich in protein. She has been in this business for several years, and it has gone very well for her.  

She also sells milk in an itinerant manner.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more guinea pigs. 

Raquel is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs

loans.name: Yojana Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Balzar se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia San Placido del cantón Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora en su gran mayoría dedicada a las faenas del campo.

En este lugar vive la señora Yojana, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 2 años  de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y  productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana en esta actividad y en su casa todos los días ya que allí tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cinco  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y alimentos para los pollos. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Balzar meets every fifteen days in the parish of San Placido in the Portoviejo Canton.  This is a place known for its kind, hard-working people, most of whom work in the country.

This is where we met Yojana, 34, who is married and has two children, ages six and two, the oldest of which is in school.  Her husband is a driver.

She is a homemaker who earns her own income to help her husband cover household expenses.  She sells clothing by catalogue and Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works three days a week in this activity and at home every day on her small farm where she raises chickens.  She sells her products on credit and collects payment every eight days.  For five years she has been in business and it is going well for her.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and chicken feed.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she enjoys it because the payments are easy to make.

Her goal is to give her young children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and chicken feed.

loans.name: Melva Del Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Balzar se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia San Placido del cantón Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora en su gran mayoría dedicada a las faenas del campo.

En este lugar vive la señora Melva, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos desde víveres hasta productos de bazar y papelería,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están  desocupados, pero por lo general ella es la que mas pasa en su negocio. Tiene más de 40 años con su tienda la cual le ha permitido ganar algo y estar atenta a las necesidades de sus hijos cuando estos estaban pequeños.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Lleva 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan estos créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante por el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Balzar meets every fifteen days in the parish of San Placido in the Portoviejo Canton.  This is a place known for its kind, hard-working people who mostly work in the country.

This is where we met Melva, 58, who is married and has eight adult children.  Three of them still lives at home.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a store in her house where she sells all kinds of groceries, bazaar items and stationery supplies.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., and sometimes later.  Her children and husband help her with the work when they can, but usually she is the one who spends most of her time in the store.  She has been in business for over 40 years, and has been able to earn a profit and stay aware of her children's needs when they were small.

This loan will be used to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other products.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years and she believes the loans are helpful to her.

Her goal is to get ahead so her family can lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other products.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru:
Хосият на протяжении десяти лет занимается шитьем национальной мужской одежды "Чапан". Чапан - это плащ-пальто, которое носят в осеннее и зимнее время года. Шитьем Хосият занимается вместе с дочерью. Хосият портниха, она также занимается шитьем национальных платьев по заказу. Она предоставляет услугу у себя дома.
Хосият жительница города Вахдат. Она родилась в 1961 году. Хосият разведена, у нее пятеро детей. Хосият имеет средне - специальное образование. Он просит кредит для приобретения материалов и тканей с целью расширения своей деятельности. Она нуждается в помощи.
texts.en: Throughout the last ten years, Khosiyat has worked as a seamstress making the national men's clothing "Chapan." A chapan is a trench coat which is worn during autumn and winter. Khosiyat does sewing along with her daughter. Khosiyat is a seamstress who also sews custom-ordered national dresses. She provides her services in her own house.
