Khosiyat is a resident of the city of Vakhdat. She was born in 1961. Khosiyat is divorced and has five children. Khosiyat has a secondary-specialized education. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials and fabric for the purpose of expanding her activities. She requires your help.

loans.use: To purchase materials and fabric.

loans.name: Ansata Ousmane's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé  le 02 Décembre 2002  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 25 femmes qui toutes issues du même village, ces dernières sont très dynamiques  et très déterminées  dans leur activité, elles sont d’un comportement exemplaire. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ansata  (assise à l’extrême droite et en médaillons en bas) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans, est mariée et mère de 03 enfants (01 garçon et 02 filles). Elle est vendeuse de thé vert,  de sucre de Jumbo, etc. Elle pratique aussi l’agriculture durant la saison des pluies depuis plusieurs décennies.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter : 05 kilos de sucre à 650 FCFA le kilo, 10 paquets de 10 boîtes de thé vert à 500 FCFA l’unité,  des condiments  en quantité.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de consolider son épargner  en vu d’accroître sa capacité de financement  et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de scolarité des enfants
texts.en:
This group was created on December 2, 2002, the day the banc villageois was inaugurated. The group is composed of 25 women from the same village. They are very energetic and determined and have excellent character. Their main business activity is retail.

Mrs. Ansata (seated on the far right and pictured in the smaller photo below) is the star borrower of the group. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of three (one son and two daughters). She sells green tea, sugar, products of the Jumbo brand [e.g. bouillon cubes and condiments], etc. She also has been working as a farmer during the rainy season for dozens of years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy five kg [11 lbs] of sugar at 650 West African francs per kg, 10 packs of green tea (with ten boxes in each) at 500 West African Francs per unit and a large quantity of condiments. The revenues from her business will allow her to build up her savings, with the goal of increasing her financing, and to help her husband provide for their children’s education.

loans.use: to buy granulated sugar and green tea for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Emma requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like pants, blouses, perfumes and other ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like pants, blouses, perfumes and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia Guadalupe sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Ricchary Purisun - oropesa” y sigue viviendo en la provincia de  Oropesa situado en el departamento de Cusco a 30 minutos en expreso local.
La socia Guadalupe nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella tiene 46 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos de 18, 17, 12, 10, 5 años de edad. 
La socia Guadalupe sigue con el negocio de venta de panes como por ejemplo chutas, rejillas, mollete y otros, ella sigue alternando sus actividades del hogar con su stand que puso junto al paradero de Oropesa en donde vende sus ricos panes, ella sigue preparando panes y los sigue vendiendo en su stand. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar ingredientes como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y otras cosas más.  

La socia Guadalupe agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, belongs to the Ricchary Purisun - Oropesa communal bank and she still lives in the province of Oropesa, 30 minutes from Cusco by local express.  She was born in the city of Ollantaytambo, is 46 years old and has 5 children who are 18, 17, 12, 10, and 5 years old.

Guadalupe is still in business selling bread, such as chutas, rejillas, mollete and other types of bread.  She still takes care of her home while running her business at the stand near the Oropesa stop where she sells the delicious bread she makes.  The loan she is requesting this time is to buy ingredients such as sacks of sugar, sacks of flour and other items.

Guadalupe is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as sacks of sugar, sacks of flour and other items.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina nació en la ciudad de Lucre pero vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, ella tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de socia Alejandrina es la crianza animales menores como por ejemplo  gallinas y cuyes, ella también se dedica a la agricultura donde siembre papa, cebada, quinua, trigo y otras más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.  En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para comprar alimentos para sus animales como por ejemplo vitaminas, concentrados y  otros más.
texts.en:
Alejandrina was born in the city of Lucre, but she lives in the city of Oropesa in the Cusco province.  She is 46 years old and married.  She has three children as a result of this beautiful relationship.

Alejandrina’s main business activity is raising and selling small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She also grows potatoes, barley, quinoa, wheat, and others.  She has been in this business for several years, and it has gone very well for her.

Alejandrina now needs a loan to buy feed for her animals.  For example, she will buy things like vitamins, concentrated feed, and others.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.  For example, she will buy things like vitamins, concentrated feed, and others.

loans.name: Omm Namah Sivaya - B Group

texts.en: This group is called Omm Namah Sivaya-B (named after a Hindu God). All the group members are women from the village of Duajhar, a rural village of Odisha state in India. The featured member of this group is Tilottama, sitting second from the left and raising her hand in the photo. She is 35 years old, living with her husband and three daughters. She is a very active lady of BPL (below poverty line) category. For the last 10 years, she has been running a tent house (giving bowl, tent, cloth boundary wall, chairs, light, sound system etc. rented for social functions) with the help of her husband. She initially started the business with limited items like bowls, chairs, tarpaulin etc. As she owned a small house, she stored some items for the tent house in her house and some items in a rented house.  At that time, she was earning a monthly income of Rs 4,000 per month. With her limited earnings, it was very difficult on her part to manage her household expenses. With the present loan, Tilottama has decided to purchase a sound system, some more chairs, bowls, drums, mats, pillows etc.to rent, taking into consideration the present demand. This will help her to generate extra income to meet her immediate requirements like providing a better education for her children in the nearby advanced school. She has a long-term vision to construct a go-down (warehouse) of her own to keep the tent house materials safely as at present she is keeping the materials in a rented go-down (warehouse). The other three members of the group are Kumudini, Laxmi and Bisaya who sell betel nuts, run a grocery shop and run a tiffin (light meal) restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a sound system, big bowls, chairs etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and married with six children. Nenita works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell in her general store. Nenita has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Juliana, ella tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real, la socia se sigue dedicando a la Ganadería, principalmente  la producción de leche y en la  elaboración de productos lácteos como queso, además de esto, ella también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de maíz y papa. La señora Juliana a sabido aprender muy bien esta actividad y es con esta que saca adelante a toda su familia.
Juliana necesita elaborar más queso, pero la producción de leche de sus vacas no son suficientes, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar leche para la fabricación del queso.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Juliana pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member is Juliana, 61, who is married and has four children.  She lives in the district of Tambo Real and continues with her livestock business, mainly producing dairy products such as cheese.  She also grows corn and potatoes.  Juliana has learned a lot about this activity and has been able to provide for her entire family.  Juliana needs to make more cheese but does not have enough milk from her cows.  Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy milk to produce cheese.  

The member is grateful to KIVA for helping her develop this activity and she is committed to paying the loan back on time.  Juliana belongs to the communal bank "San Bartolo de Tambo Real" in the district of Tambo Real, Anta Province in Cusco - Peru.

loans.use: To buy milk.

loans.name: Sixta María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Balzar se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia San Placido del cantón Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora en su gran mayoría dedicada a las faenas del campo.

En este lugar vive la señora Sixta, tiene 57  años de edad, es madre soltera de  6 hijos todos mayores de edad pero dos de ellos aun viven en su casa.

Ella para poder salir adelante sola y para tener para los gastos del hogar hace tres años empezó un negocio, tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa donde prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los  días y prepara desayunos, almuerzos, sus hijos le ayudan en los momentos que tiene más gente a su restaurante, el cual es muy concurrido ya que ella cocina delicioso y  varia el menú todo los días lo cual le agrada a sus clientes.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  diez años y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución.
omprar  
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
The Balzar communal bank meets every fifteen days in the parish of San Placido in the Portoviejo Canton.  This is a place known for its kind, hard-working people, most of whom work in the country.

This is where we met Sixta, 57, who is a single mother of six adult children, two of which still live at home.

To be able to provide an income to cover household expenses, she started a small restaurant in her house three years ago, and serves delicious meals.  She works every day and prepares breakfast and lunch.  Her children help out when the restaurant is busy, which is often because of her good cooking.  She changes the menu every day which is popular among customers.

This loan is to buy rice, meat, fish and other groceries to make the meals.  She has been a member of the communal bank for ten years and enjoys the benefits offered by the institution.

Her goal is to get ahead in both life and business.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish and other groceries.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is  37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with two children. 

Teresa  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Teresa is a new member of HSPFI. 

In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel used his previous loan amount to buy stocks of goods for his retail shop. He bought rice, sugar, and boxes of bar soap, and it has been profitable.

He plans to use this third loan amount to buy more stocks of timber for sell in his timber yard business.  He also plans to use part of the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm.


With the anticipated profits from his businesses, he will pay school fees for his children. Daniel hopes to become one of the leading timber sellers in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of timber to sell.

loans.name: Hari Omm Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Hari Omm” (named after the Hindu Lord Vishnu). All four members of this group are women from the village of Thakpali and are in the Below Poverty Line category. Thakpali is located in the district of Nuapada, one of the poorest districts in India. Tanaya is one of the members of this group. She is raising her hand in the photo. She is 31 years old and lives with her husband, two sons age 11 and 9 and a daughter age 13. All her children are attending schools in her locality. Her staple occupation is farming, from which she gets a low return, making it very difficult to maintain her family. So she thought of an additional income source and started a milk business with the help of her husband in the year 2010. Now she has five cows producing 20 liters of milk per day. Tanaya’s husband supplies this milk to a restaurant in a nearby town on a daily basis. As there is growing demand for milk in her locality, Tanaya plans to use a portion of her loan to purchase another cow of an improved variety and the rest to repair the cow shed and purchase fodder. Tanaya has a dream of developing a dairy farm in the future and providing a better education for her children.

The other three members (Padmini, Patanti and Khamani) are running a general store, selling dry food and running a spices business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and repair a cow shed.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a 48-year-old father of four children, is a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. He is married to Hannah, who is also a farmer.

Having repaid his first loan, David plans to use this second loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and cattle feeds. He will use the resulting income to pay school fees for his children and also open a green grocery shop.

David hopes to invest more in dairy farming since the demand for milk in the area has increased.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and cattle feeds.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas used his previous loan to buy more timber to sell in his business, and it was profitable. He also has a retail shop, and plans to use this second loan to buy more items to sell including rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil.

Thomas will use his income to pay school fees for his children. He plans to grow his business and eventually open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is Maa Thakurani (named after a village deity of the locality). All four women members of this group are from the village of Thakpali in Nuapada district of Odisha, India and belong to the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category.  People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day. Jamuna, standing nearest to the cow with her hand raised, is the featured member of the group. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two sons who are 23 and 18 years old.
 
Jamuna’s husband is a farmer and Jamuna works as a helper in the Centre of Integrated Child Development Scheme project in their village. She earns a monthly remuneration of Rs 1,000/-. In comparison to the family needs, the income from the above sources is not sufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family. So, looking at market demand and their traditional occupation (raising cows), in the year 2010 Jamuna purchased a cow and started a milk business. Presently, she is getting 6 liters of milk per day from a single cow and supplying it to a tea stall in a nearby town @ 16/-. This additional income helps her to a great extent in maintaining the educational expenses of her two sons. Looking at her success in the milk business. Jamuna has planned to invest a portion of her loan to buy another cow of the jersey variety and the rest to repair her cow shed to get more output. Jamuna dreams of developing a dairy farm in the future and supplying milk to the milk processing plant. The other three members of her group (Nalini, Jugalmati and Kshame) are also running similar businesses .

loans.use: to purchase a cow and repair the cow shed.

loans.name: Philimon

texts.en:
Philimon farms in his local home area in Nyamira, Kenya; poultry is his main produce for the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business for additional income. He is married with one child.

Philimon has made a request of a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He hopes to increase his family income and meet basic family needs with ease. He says the future for his farming business looks bright with the existence of farming loans.

Philimon says the main challenge is lack of finances to carry out meaningful farming.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married, 55 years of age, and lives in Liposong, Ozamis City, together with her two kids. 

Lourdes is operating a general store to earn a living. She's in this business for six years, and she earns PHP 6,000 every month. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She joined GDMPC this year. Lourdes wishes that her business will be more progressive.

In the future, Lourdes will use her income to support her two kids in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with three children. 

Jovelyn is providing motorela, or motorcycle, services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for maintaining the motorcycle.

Jovelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for maintaining a motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John farms in Olkalou town where he plants cash crops and keeps livestock. He is 44 years old, married to Rachel, and they have three children in school.

With this being his fifth loan from KADET, he plans to buy animal feed for his cattle. He also plans to buy fertilizer and manure for use in his farm. He will use the generated income to buy a dairy cow and hence boost his dairy farming.

He hopes to invest more in dairy farming, make more income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Karine

texts.ru:
28 летняя Карине организовала свой собственный бизнес в 2010 году. Имея двухлетний опыт юридической деятельности, она арендовала помещение, в котором открыла свою небольшую адвокатскую контору. Карине берется за небольшие дела, но надеется что вместе с приобретенным опытом работы сможет расширить свой бизнес в будущем. Карине работает без выходных и до позднего вечера. Благодаря своему бизнесу, она имеет возможность содержать свою молодую семью, которая состоит из безработного мужа и годовалой дочери. 
Карине родилась в Капане и после окончания капанской средней школы поступила и окончила Российский Государственный торгово-экономический университет в городе Пятигорске, Россия, по специальности юриспруденция. 
Карине необходим кредит на сумму $730 для приобретения офисной мебели, принтера и компьютера для своей конторы.
texts.en: 28 year-old Karine started her own business in 2010. With two years of legal experience, she rented some space and opened her own small law office. Karine works on relatively small cases, but hopes that the experience she gains will enable her to expand her business in the future. Karine doesn't take days off and works late into the evening. Thanks to her business, she has the opportunity to support her young family, which consists of an unemployed husband and a one year-old daughter. Karine was born in Kapan and after finishing high school, graduated with a major in law from the Russian State University of Trade and Economics in Piatigorsk, Russia. Karine needs a loan in the amount of $730 to buy office furniture, a printer, and a computer for her office.

loans.use: To buy office furniture, computer and printer for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She operates a pigpen, and sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 8 years. Evangeline has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 23-year-old married woman.  She got married in her early age and faced many problems in running her house. Her husband is employed in a small general store and earns not enough income to provide his family with bread and butter. Six years ago, she initiated a business of making paper envelopes to support her family.

Abida has four children. She is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with the support of it. Now she requested for a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy bundles of paper at lower rates from the market. She hopes to have an increase in sales and desires to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: buy paper to make envelopes

loans.name: Fas' Group

texts.en: Fas, aged 50 and residing in the Sangke district of Battambang province, is a widow mother of three children, two of whom are working at a construction site. To make a living, she catches fish to sell as her main source of income. She also makes casting net for additional income. Fas' group is comprised of three female members and all members are first-time borrowers. Fas is seeking 500,000 KHR and another fellow is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a small boat for supporting her fish-catching business. She hopes to catch more fish and sell them for a good price so she can better support her family.

loans.use: To buy a small boat for supporting her fish-catching business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: CELIA TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA Y VIVE CON SU MADRE, QUIEN ES VIUDA DESDE HACE YA VARIOS AÑOS. ELLA TRABAJA EN EL DIF DE LA CIUDAD COMO TRABAJADORA SOCIAL. Y POR LAS TARDES SE DEDICA A ATENDER SU NEGOCIO PROPIO. VENDE ARTICULOS PARA LA DECORACION DE INTERIORES Y UN POCO DE ROPA NUEVA. CELIA AYUDA A SU MADRE CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA YA QUE LAS DOS VIVEN SOLAS EN SU CASA. COMO ELLA DESEA INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS PARA PODER AYUDAR MAS A SU MADRE, HA VISTO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE REALIZAR LA COMPRA DE MAS MERCANCIA, LA CUAL SEA NOVEDOSA Y ATRACTIVA PARA SUS CLIENTES. POR ESTE MOTIVO ELLA SOLICITA UN PRESTAMO PARA REALIZAR LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA CON LA CUAL HARA CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y SUS GANANCIAS AUMENTEN PARA EL BIENESTAR DE ELLA Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Celia is 24 years old, is single and lives with her mother who has been a widow for several years.  Celia works for a City department as a social worker and in the afternoons she takes care of her own business.  She sells items for interior decoration as well as some new clothing.  Celia helps her mother with the household expenses since the two of them live alone in the house.

Since she wants to increase her sales in order to support her mother, she has looked to the opportunity to buy more merchandise which will be novel and attractive to her clients.  Because of this she is requesting a loan to complete the purchase of the merchandise which will make her business grow and her earnings increase for the good of herself and her family.

loans.use: to complete the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron la elaboración de panes y el negocio de la venta de panes de “Chuta”.  Ahora Cirila sigue dedicándose a la preparación de los panes, ella como la mayoría de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio tienen que alquilar los hornos por horas para poder elaborar sus panes.

En esta oportunidad Cirila requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de  harina, levadura, sacos de azúcar y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Cirila's parents taught her to make bread and the business of selling "Chuta" bread.  Now Cirila continues working in the preparation of breads, and like the majority of people who do this work, she has to rent ovens by the hour to be able to make her bread.  

Cirila needs this loan to purchase basic ingredients such as bags of flour, yeast, bags of sugar and many other things.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, yeast, bags of sugar and many other things.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Ms. Shameem  is 47 years old, an energetic married woman. She has been in the business of making red chili powder for eight years and has previously received funds through Kashf Foundation. She buys red chilies in bulk from the nearby city and sells the powdered form in her town. It is very commonly used in food for taste. 

Shameem is a mother of five children. She lives in a large traditional family with her husband, children, and other relatives. Her husband is not in good enough physical shape to be employed. She needs to earn alone to cover everyday expenditures of her family.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Rs.30,000/-. She will be using the loan to buy a large quantity of red chilies to expand her product supply. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She intends to utilize the earned profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of red chilies to expand her product supply.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a grocery business in Nakuru town where she sells tomatoes, onions, and vegetables among other items. She is 22 years old and a single mother of one child.

This being her first loan, she plans to use it to buy more potatoes, carrots, and vegetables. The demand being high from her clients, she anticipates making more profits with which she'll buy more grocery items such as cereals and fruits.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business, make more income, and provide for the needs of her child. She also plans to open a boutique business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has three young children. She has been running a grocery store for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Erlinda sell various products in her store to the people in her locality. However, she needs more funds for the expansion of her venture. She is asking for a loan worth 26,000 PHP to buy more stock to sell in her store such as bread and biscuits, soda, cooking ingredients, washing materials, shampoo, and many more items. With this loan, she will be able to augment her stocks and attract more customers to buy in her store.

In the future, Erlinda wants to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to continually send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store such as bread and biscuits, soda, cooking ingredients, washing materials, and other items.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is a heavy pineapple-producing region. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 20 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops. She will use the loan to increase the number of poultry birds on her farm.

She has stated what is most enjoyable about her farm: "I enjoy poultry farming!" Her biggest challenges are 'Marketing of products and the low selling prices for the products.' Animals on the farm have been given names such as Meni, which is the white mark on the cows forehead.

Jacinta was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "I love farming and Juhudi is offering loans for that."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Micro-financing can help small scale farmers to grow."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?," Jacinta replied, "Poultry will give me income which will enable me to provide for my family's needs."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jacinta owns cows, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own pigs, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and solar power but does NOT have electricity, running water, sewing machine, a TV,  or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use--making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
At age 41, Pov is a widowed mother of two children. She and her family live in a rural area located in the Sa Ang district of the Kandal province. Pov has been planting taros on her 1.5 hectares of farmland for 21 years to support her family. Her business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day. She manages  to save about 8,000 KHR per day after daily expenses. 

Pov’s Group consists of three members who live in the same village. This will be Pov's third loan. The past loans have helped her better support her current business. Now she and her group members are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Pov is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and taro seeds for her business. She hopes to increase her income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and taro seeds.

loans.name: Teang

texts.en: Teang, 33, is a mother of two small children who are not yet school-aged. She earns a living from her one hectare of paddy by growing rice. To better support her family, she also works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for five years, earning about 25,000 KHR. She is challenged to by the floods which lower her yield. This is the fourth-cycle for Teang. The past loans, which she has paid back, have helped her to stabilize her living condition. Now she is seeking a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR to buying pillars to build her house. She expects to own a decent proper house for her family, so she can pay more attention to generating more income for her children's sake.

loans.use: to buying pillars to build her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa donde su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, la socia Marleny en sus horas libres se dedica ayudar a la demás panaderas en la elaboración del pan “Chuta”. En esta oportunidad Marleny requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales como por ejemplo gallinas, chanchos y cuyes.
texts.en:
Marleny is 28 years old, is married and the fruit of this beautiful relationship is three children.  She lives in the city of Oropesa where her principal economic activity is the raising of small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.  

In her free time, Marleny works helping other bakers in the making of "Chuta" bread.  

Marleny needs this loan to buy more animals such as chickens, pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as chickens, pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Voeurn's Group

texts.en: Aged 46, Voeurn is a widowed mother with nine children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer on an area of about one and half hectare which is her main source of income. Her main challenge is the drought which reduces her yield. The current business earns her about 8,500 KHR per day, but she can save only 2,300 KHR per day after daily expenses. Voeurn has never been with VisionFund before, the same as her co-member. She is in a group of two members. Now she is applying for 1,000,000 KHR while the other group member is seeking 600,000 KHR. She, as the leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to hire labor for plowing her farmland. She hopes to grow her crop timely so that she can earn double her income to better feed her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire labor for plowing her farmland

loans.name: Chanthea's Group

texts.en:
Chanthea lives in a wooden house in a rural area of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district in Cambodia. She is 25 years old, married and has two children who are yet too young for school. 

Chanthea and her husband have farmed rice for six years (she relates that drought is their main challenge). She earns about 18,000 KHR a day. Her husband also works at an additional job to help support the family. 

Chanthea is now the leader of a group of two that is applying for a 1,400,000 KHR loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The past two loans have enabled her to renovate her house. 

With her portion of this loan Chanthea will buy fertilizer for her land. She hopes to reap a large profit from her paddy rice so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen sigue dedicándose ayudar a preparar pan. Ya son varios  años que trabaja en el horno y le va muy bien.  Carmen nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño negocio independiente que consiste en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas. 

Carmen pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen continues to earn a living helping make bread. She has worked for a number of years now in the bake shop and it's going very well for her. Carmen tells us that she has a small independent business which consists of caring for small animals such as hens. In this opportunity she needs the loan to purchase hens. 

Carmen belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" communal bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and so she commits to making her payments according to plan.

loans.use: to purchase hens.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo   actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar insumos  como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella  tiene pensado comprar  estos insumos para asistir el café de una  mejor forma y así poder obtener una mejor cosecha para  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Nery, 50, is married living with her husband at present.  She intends to use the loan to buy supplies like manure and fumigation and to help pay labor costs.  She’s thinking about buying these supplies to better help her coffee crops so that she can obtain a better harvest and earn more profits that way thus obtaining a better quality of life and economic stability.  This is her first loan from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more tools to repair the sofa.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and married to Diosdado. She manages a store where she sells various products to members of the community. She is a very responsible mother who is able to support her family. 

Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy products to sell in the community. She hopes that her business will do well so that she can expand her business and she can cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice and snack foods for her business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. To tackle her family's financial difficulties, she works at a factory whilst her husband works at construction sites. She has been with this business for five years. 

Thy has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and has successfully and entirely paid back the loans. Because of the successful loans, she has mainly supported her work and was able to buy a decent motorbike for getting to work on time. For this loan, as the fifth, she will use the loan amount of $1,000 USD to buy necessary materials  for building her house and a decent latrine for her family.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for building her house and a decent latrine.

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is 61 years old and is engaged in vegetable vending  as a source of income. She has been doing this for almost 10 years, earning about PHP 5,000 every month which is not enough to cover their necessities.

She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to buy eggplant, cabbage and beans to sell in the village. She hopes these additions will lead to growing of her income. After all, she is giving her best to create a better income and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbage and beans

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta, 61, is a widow and mother to three adult-aged children. She lives separately with her grandchild in San Manuel, Isabela. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her fish selling business that she has already been managing for 25 years now.

All of her children finished college by means of her selling fish in public markets. During their studies, she doubled her time just to get a larger income for their allowances. Now that they have finished school, her children have told her not to sell anymore but she feels weak when she is not doing the things she used to do, hence she is still selling fish at least once a week.

Fausta even recalls that her first loan borrowed in this ASKI loan program was in the year 2006. The money borrowed had served as her capital in the business throughout the years.

loans.use: to use as additional revolving capital for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Five Queen Lom Group

texts.en:
Niandeihnuam (the lady with her right hand raised) is a member of Five Queen Lom group that was formed three years ago. She is 28 years old and a mother of four  school-going children (two girls and two boys). Her husband Chinlianthang is a part-time vehicle driver. 

Niandeihnuam first took a loan from WSDS for setting up a vegetable vending business. With the support of her husband, they manage to grow their business with hard work and dedication. Today, the vegetable vending shop has been upgraded to a Variety Store in her locality by adding more items like soap, toiletries, meat spices, rice, dal, sugar, etc. Niandeihnuam's successes have boosted the other members' confidence so that today the other members have their own small enterprises of vegetable vending, 'pan" shop and grocery shop. 

With the loan from KIVA, the Five Queen Lom will utilise expand their respective small business enterprises. Niandeihnuam will utilise the loan to stock rice, sugar, mustard oil, etc. that she will be able to purchase in larger quantity.

loans.use: to extend her store and buy more items for her inventory

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia has been selling sandals and slippers within her local community. She acquires her products once a month at Gapan Nueva Ecija.

Arsenia is married having four grown up children. Three of her children have settled in marriage while the other one is still single and working. Arsenia would like to earn greater income allowing her to cover all their household expenses. At her very best, she find ways to make her retail business more profitable.

Arsenia plans to buy more and various kinds of sandals and slippers in order to satisfy her costumers' demands and encourage more costumers to buy her products.  The capital she had is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP (Phillipine Peso). She hopes to get this loan amount to attain her goals in life and also with her business.

The child on the business picture is her grandson.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sandals and slippers for her retail business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos, uno en el colegio  y  el otro le ayudan en las labores del campo actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos para mantener el  almacigo de café para su posterior siembra  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado sembrar   este almacigo para poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica y poder pagar el estudio de los hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carlos, 35, is married and lives with his wife and two children; one is in school and the other helps him with his work in the fields.  He intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies to care for his coffee seedlings for their subsequent planting and to pay labor costs.  He’s thinking about planting the seedlings in order to produce a bit more and earn higher profits to attain a better quality of life and economic stability to be able to pay for his children’s schooling.  This is his first loan with Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur gave him the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, tiene la edad  de 55 años, está soltera,  vive con su hija  la cual es una niña con discapacidad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar telas de varias clases y colores. Ella  tiene pensado comprar estas telas para hacer gran variedad de ropa como piyamas para bebes, ropa interior para hombres y mujeres y además ella se dedica arreglar maquinas de coser, ella con todo esto espera  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida  para ella y su hija y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Margarita is 55 years old, single, and lives with her daughter, who is disabled. She wants to purchase different types of fabric in different colors with this loan. She intends to buy the fabric in order to make a variety of clothing items, such as babies' pajamas and men and women's underwear. She also works repairing sewing machines. She expects to generate more income with all of this and achieve a better quality of life for herself and her daughter, as well as financial stability. 

This is the first loan she receives from Fudecosur. She has never taken out any loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has offered her a loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, él vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusc, él tiene 47 años de edad y tiene un hijo.

Victor sigue dedicándose a la venta de panes “Chutas” en la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento del Puno.  Victor desde 15 años que sigue dedicándose  a la panadería y a la panadería. En esta oportunidad Victor requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales o insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina y levadura para preparar más panes.
texts.en:
Victor belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchariy Puririsun” communal bank.  He lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province.  He’s 47-years-old and has a son.

He continues selling “Chutas” [traditional large bread rolls typical of Oropesa]  in the city of Juliaca, Puno Department.  Victor has been working in the bakery for 15 years.  On this occasion, he needs the loan to buy materials and supplies like sacks of flour and yeast, for example, to make more bread.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and yeast.

loans.name: Edgar Gerardo

texts.es: Edgar Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y tres hijos,  los cuales  le ayudan en las labores del campo actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos para mantener el  café en producción. El tiene pensado comprar  abono para que la plantación mantenga la producción y no bote el café y se madure de una mejor forma y poder venderlo en el mercado de la localidad y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Edgar Gerardo, 52, is married and lives with his wife and three children who help him with his work in the fields.  He intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies to continue growing coffee.  He’s thinking about buying manure so that the plantation will remain in production and the coffee beans won’t drop off but rather ripen properly so that they can be sold in the local market for a better price and he can earn higher profits to attain a better quality of life and economic stability.  This is his first loan with Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur gave him the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn's business is selling a variety of vegetables in the market. She is 46 years old and married. She lives with her family in the village of Mabantad. 

She has been in her business for 15 years, and she earns about PHP 2,500 a week. She is thankful because through her business, she was able to provide their daily needs. 

Jocelyn wants to have more vegetables to sell. To make it possible, she is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy onions, garlic, eggplants, string beans, and tomatoes to sell. She believes that this loan will enable her to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, eggplants, string beans, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline has been in the cereals business in Nyahururu town for two years. She is 47 years old, married to Geoffrey, and has two children. Besides her cereals business, she also rears poultry. This is Pauline’s second loan, and she plans to use to it to buy broilers (chickens) and later sell them. Pauline hopes to grow her business by distributing poultry and eggs to various hotels in the area.

loans.use: To buy broilers for rearing and later resale at a profit.

loans.name: Brenda Vania

texts.es: La Sra. Brenda es una persona que por sus propios medios se dio la oportunidad de realizar una carrera técnica, la cual el día de hoy le permite generar una fuente de empleo. Estudio la carrera de Serigrafía porque le llamaba mucho la atención la impresión de logotipos e instintivos en poleras, tasas, bolígrafos, por lo que ella ahora trata de innovar productos que puedan publicitar a empresas o instituciones. Es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar, su esposo también trabaja en el rubro, ayudando con la entrega de los pedidos, como también llevando oficios y propuestas a estas empresas, algunas por el tiempo que ya la conocen solicitan nuevamente de su servicio y su trabajo y otras son referidas de las anteriores. Ella sueña algún día lograr una oficina propia desde la cual pueda canalizar estos servicios, porque actualmente trabaja con empresas grandes, de las cuales necesita alquilar maquinarias como el horno UV, la plancha industrial, y también el Tampográffo. Sus ingresos básicamente le ayudan a cubrir gastos familiares como también el alquiler de estos equipos, necesita de este crédito para abastecerse de mayor material  como tintas de diferentes colores, mallas para diferentes tipos de logos y así poder realizar contratos más grandes.
texts.en:
Ms. Brenda is a person who, by her own means, took the opportunity to study for a technical degree which today allows her to generate a source of employment. She studied Silk Screening because her attention was strongly drawn by logo and insignia printing on shirts, cups and pens and so now she tries to come up with innovative products which may serve to advertise businesses or institutions. She is the mother of two school-aged children and her husband also works in the business, helping deliver orders as well as carrying letters and proposals to businesses, some of whom place new orders based on having known her service and work for some time, and others who are referred by the former. 

She dreams of one day having her own office from which she might direct these services because currently she works with large businesses from whom she must rent machines such as a UV oven, an industrial iron and also a pad printer. Her income basically helps to cover her family's expenses as well as the rental of this equipment. She needs this loan to stock up on more materials, such as dyes of various colors and screens for various types of logos, so that she may fulfill larger contracts.

loans.use: to purchase dyes and screens for her silk screening business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles for making school and office uniforms

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, ella tiene 45 años de edad y tiene tres hijos de las cuales todos son independientes. 

Marcelina se sigue dedicándose  a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. 

En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar y levadura.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchariy Puririsun” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province.  She’s 45-years-old, and has three children all of whom are independent.

Marcelina makes and sells “Chutas” [traditional large bread rolls typical of Oropesa and Cusco].  On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy materials and supplies like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast, for example.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast.

loans.name: Poline

texts.en: Poline is 26 years old and a single mother of one child. She has a clothing sales business in Nakuru town. She has been in the business for four years and it has been profitable. This is Poline’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to buy more stock of ladies’ wear and children’s clothes. She will use the profits generated to buy a wider  variety of clothes. Poline hopes to grow her business and open a boutique to make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ladies’ wear and children’s clothes

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
Washington pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, él vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, él tiene 23 años de edad y tiene un hijo. 
Washington se dedica a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. 
En esta oportunidad Washington requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar y levadura.
texts.en:
Washington belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchariy Puririsun” communal bank.  He lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province.  He’s 23-years-old and has a son.

Washington makes and sells “Chutas” [traditional large bread rolls typical of Oropesa and Cusco].  On this occasion, he needs the loan to buy materials and supplies like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast, for example.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, ella tiene 45  años de edad y tiene tres  hijos. 
Bertha se dedica a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. 

En esta oportunidad Bertha requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar y levadura.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchariy Puririsun” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province.  She’s 45-years-old, and has three children.

Bertha makes and sells “Chutas” [traditional large bread rolls typical of Oropesa and Cusco].  On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy materials and supplies like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast, for example.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.es:
Oliver pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, él vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, él tiene 20 años de edad y tiene un hijo. 

Oliver se dedica a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. 

En esta oportunidad Oliver requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar y levadura.
texts.en:
Oliver belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchariy Puririsun” communal bank.  He lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province.  He’s 20-years-old and has a son.

Oliver makes and sells “Chutas” [traditional large bread rolls typical of Oropesa and Cusco].  On this occasion, he needs the loan to buy materials and supplies like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast, for example.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Даврону 26 лет.  Он добросовестный и трудолюбивый мужчина, женат и на воспитании имеет сына. Сын  несовершеннолетний. Его отец работает шофёром и одновременно с Давроном занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Даврон имеет достаточного опыта по скотоводству и земледелием.  В основном он выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и картошку. Часть полученного урожая он использует в качестве корма для скота, а оставшуюся часть продаёт местным жителям. Большая часть населения данного села приобретают пшеницу, а затем на мельнице получают муку и выпекают хлеб для личного пользования, отход от пшеницы используют для откорма скота. По словам Даврона у него есть хорошее условие для животноводства, но не имеет денежного средства для приобретения скота.  От полученных доходов он хочет улучшить условию своего домохозяйства. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки 5 голов коровы. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Davron is 26 years old.  He is a conscientious and hardworking man, who is married and raising an adolescent son.  His father works as a driver and is also simultaneously involved in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops with Davron.  Davron has plenty of experience in animal husbandry and farming.  He primarily grows wheat, barley and potatoes.  He uses a portion of the harvest as a feed for livestock and sells the remainder to the local residents.  A large number of this village population buy wheat and then obtain flour at a mill and bake bread for personal consumption, and use the waste from the wheat to feed livestock.  According to Davron's words, he has good conditions for animal husbandry, but does not have enough financial means to purchase livestock.  He wants to use the resulting income to improve his household conditions.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to buy five cows.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy five cows

loans.name: Gulry

texts.ru: Гулру уже второй цикл кредитуется в МЗО Имон Интернешенл. Она имеет хорошую кредитную историю и является честным человеком. Ей 37 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Она работает учительницей в средней школе и одновременно занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. В основном она выращивает ячмень и пшеницу. Ее муж помогает в ведении бизнеса. Они продают на рынке полученный урожай, но их доход не позволяют им отремонтировать их дом. Гулру запрашивает кредит на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulry has been obtaining financing from Imon International for the second cycle now.  She has a good credit history and is an honest person.  She is 37 years old, married and raising two children.  Gulry works as a teacher at a secondary school and is simultaneously involved in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops.  She primarily grows barley and wheat.  Her husband helps her with running the business.  They sell their harvest at a market, but their income does not allow them to repair their house.  Gulry is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to purchase construction materials.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastina  pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella  vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, ella tiene 26 años de edad y tiene dos hijos.
 
Sebastina  se dedica a la venta de frutas de forma ambulatoria, ella vende ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulatoria. Además, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas, cuyes y otras más.  
 
En esta oportunidad Sebastina  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo manzana, plátanos, naranjas, fresa, granadilla y otras más.
texts.en:
Sebastiana belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchariy Puririsun” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province.  She’s 26-years-old, and has two children.

Sebastiana sells fruit and vegetables from place to place.  She also raises small farm animals like chickens, guinea pigs and others.  On this occasion, Sebastiana needs the loan to buy merchandise like apples, bananas, oranges, strawberries, sweet granadilla and others.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like apples, bananas, oranges, strawberries, sweet granadilla and others.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru:
Немат проживает в районе Спитамен. Ему 55 лет. Он женат, является отцом двоих детей. Его сын находится в Российской Федерации. Жена Немата работает уборщицей. 
Немат зарабатывает путем разведения крупного рогатого скота. Он очень хороший человек. На протяжении 24 лет Немат усердно работает, чтобы расширить свою деятельность и обеспечить свою семью. На сегодняшний день он просит кредит для закупа двух голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Nemat lives in Spitamen. He is 55 years old, married, and has two children. His son lives in the Russian Federation. Nemat's wife works as a cleaner. Nemat makes a living breeding cattle. He is a very good person. Over the course of 24 years, Nemat has worked diligently to expand his business and provide for his family. He is requesting a loan to buy two heads of cattle.

loans.use: To buy bulls

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.ru: Сураё 42 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 22 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается продажей сухофруктов как курага, сухие черносливы, орехи и т.п.  В последнее время у нее мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и он не может придерживать своих клиентов. Сураё должна срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы вернуть своих клиентов. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 2000 долларов США для того, чтобы купить сухофрукты. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Suraiyo is 42 years old, married and raising four children.  She is a very hardworking person and has over 22 years of experience in this business.  She is involved in selling dried fruits, such as dried apricots, plums, nuts and the like.  Lately, she has had a small number of clients because of high competition and inability to support her clients.  Suraiyo needs to urgently expand her product selection in order to bring back her clients.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $2000 to purchase dried fruits.  She relies on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим 36 - летний женатый мужчина. Он проживает в городе Худжанд. Абдурахим является отцом троих детей. Он вместе с семьей занимается выпечкой кондитерских изделий. У Абдурахима имеется небольшой кондитерских цех, где он занимается своей деятельностью. В этой области Абдурахим более десяти лет. Он просит кредит для покупки продуктов и приобретения необходимых оборудований.
texts.en: Abdurahim is a 36 year-old married man.  He lives in the city of Khujand.  Abdurahim is a father of three children.  He and his family are involved in baking confectionery goods.  Abdurahim has a small bakery, where he runs his business.  He has been in this field for over ten years.  Abdurahim is requesting this loan to purchase products and necessary equipment.

loans.use: to purchase products and necessary equipment

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella  vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, ella tiene 30 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. 

Judith se dedica a la distribución de insumos para preparar panes como por ejemplo sacos de harina, ella vende ofreciendo sus productos a todos sus vecinos de la ciudad de Oropesa. Además, ella también se dedica ayudar a prepara panes “Chuta”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la elaboración de panes y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Judith requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de harina.
texts.en:
Judith belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchariy Puririsun” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province.  She’s 30-years-old, and has two children.

Judith works distributing bread-making supplies like sacks of flour, for example.  She sells her products to all her neighbors in the city of Oropesa.  In addition, she also bakes “Chutas” [traditional bread rolls from the cities of Oropesa and Cusco].  She’s been working baking bread for many years and does very well.  On this occasion, Judith needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of flour, for example.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour.

loans.name: Gustavo Ariel

texts.es: Gustavo un joven muy sencillo, de buen carácter, con muchas aspiraciones,  con la idea de ayudar a su madre con los gastos familiares, es que decide dedicarse algún negocio, que le pueda generar buenas ganancias. Por consejo de una amiga de su madre, y con la orientación de la misma es que decide vender prendas de vestir para caballero y dama, con el paso del tiempo  a solicitud y sugerencia de sus mismos clientes es que va diversificando sus productos, actualmente también vende carteras y bolsos para dama. Los días jueves y domingos Gustavo casi de madrugada se dirige a la feria de El Alto, para poder ser el primer cliente, debido a  que sus proveedores traen mercadería exclusiva la cual se agota, muy temprano en la mañana. Posteriormente lleva la mercadería a su Stand y distribuye y organiza está de manera que pueda exhibir lo mejor y tenga una venta rápida.  Necesita del crédito para poder abastecer su negocio, es decir mejorar sus ventas por un mayor capital de operación. Gustavo desea estudiar una carrera Universitaria y esa es su mayor aspiración, su madre se encontraba delicada de salud, pero ahora ya esta mejorando y ella es quien le ayuda llevándole el almuerzo cada día, siempre con la idea de minimizar sus gastos, desean en algún momento independizarse, porque actualmente viven en la casa de sus abuelitos.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a modest, upstanding young man who greatly desires to help his mother with the household expenses. So he decided to start a business that would generate a good income. Following the advice of his mother's friend and his own inclinations, he began selling women's and men's clothing, and over time and at his customers' request, he began offering a wider range of items. He now sells women's purses and sweaters. At dawn on Thursdays and Sundays, Gustavo heads to the El Alto fair. He wants to be the first customer because the suppliers who offer exclusive merchandise there run out early in the morning. Later he takes the merchandise to his stand, where he attractively displays it, hoping for quick sales.

He needs the loan to stock his business, that is, to increase his sales with more operating capital. Gustavo's main goal is to study at the university. His mother's health is poor but improving. She has helped him minimize his expenses by bringing him lunch every day. They would like to live independently at some point; they now live with his grandparents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase his clothing sales (purses, sweaters, etc.)

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is still running her fruits and vegetables trading business. Thanks to her occupation, Hasmik is able to solve a part of her family’s needs. Hasmik used her first Kiva loan to buy various fruits, nuts, and also candied fruits to resell. 

In this season, Hasmik makes the main accent on grapes, apples, pears, melon, and watermelon trading. Also, she says that now potatoes are in very popular demand as in this season people buy and stock potatoes for the winter months. 

Now Hasmik is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a lot of potatoes and various fruits and berries to resell.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potatoes and various fruits and berries to resell.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, a 27-year-old father of two children, is a farmer in Olkalau town. He is married to Esther, who is also a farmer. Besides farming, Jacob is also a photographer.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to buy fertilizer for planting. He also plans to buy a camera for use in his photography business.

He hopes to grow both his businesses and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm and a camera for his photography business.

loans.name: Sarwari

texts.en:
Sarwari is 45 years old and a married woman. She has had an association with the Kashf foundation for two years.  She has an excellent repayment behavior.  

Sarwari has been in the business of making yarn by using a thread rewinding machine for the past five years. She is seeking a loan for the betterment of her business and to increase her earning capacity. 

Her husband works in a mill and earns a very low income, so she works with her husband making yarn together and supporting their family of 10 members. 

She has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase raw material such as cotton in bulk.   In this way she will be able to increase her sales by targeting more customers.  She wishes to use part of the profits on the expansion of her business and sales.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as cotton in bulk.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used his previous loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  It was profitable, and he was able to repay the loan well and in good time.

With this his fifth loan amount, he plans to buy a dairy cow.  He will use the generated profits from his farming business to buy another dairy cow.

He hopes to grow his dairy farming by distributing milk to various markets, making more income and becoming able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.ru: Прогрессивный и весьма приятный человек, которого зовут Абдукодир, более 15 лет занимается услугами такси. Ему 51 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. С детства он мечтал стать шофером, ездить по новым местам и познакомится с новыми людьми, вдохновляя себя новыми эмоциями. Реальность экономической стороны жизни приготовила для него другие ожидания. Он не в состоянии обеспечить свою семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами и ему не да новых знакомств. Его дети с годами все требуют больше блага, а также новый дом. Абдукодир начал постройку нового дома, но у него нет денег, чтобы достроить свой дом. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Он ждет вашу помощь. Помогите ему, пожалуйста, быть отцом, который в состоянии обеспечить детей с новым домом.
texts.en: Abdukodir, a progressive and fairly attractive person, has been involved in providing a taxi service for over 15 years.  He is 51 years old, married and raising four children.  Since childhood, he dreamed of becoming a driver, travel to new places and meet new people, inspiring himself with new emotions.  Life's economic reality prepared different expectations for him.  He is unable to provide his family with all of the necessary means, and meeting new people seems like a far reach for him now.  His children need more comfort as they grow and a new house.  Abdukodir started the construction of the new house, but does not have money to complete the project.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy construction materials.  He awaits your help.  Please help him to be a father, who is able to provide his children with a new house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and build a new house

loans.name: Ortikoy

texts.ru: Ортикой всегда старается улучшить условия жизни. Ей 50 лет и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант и поэтому Ортикой должна обеспечить семью с необходимыми средствами одна. Климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для скотоводства. Более 12  лет она занимается скотоводством. Она продает скот, за которым он присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Ее старший сын помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Ортикой хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму  7000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ortikoy is always trying to improve her standard of living. She is 50 years old and is raising 5 children. Her husband is a migrant worker, so Ortikoy must support her family alone. The local climate is extremely favorable for raising livestock. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 12 years. She sells the livestock after taking care of them for several months. She has many clients at the market. Her eldest son helps her run the business, Ortikoy wants to expand her business, but does not have the money for this. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 7000 somons to buy livestock in order to expand her business. She plans on using the revenue to ensure her children a good education and modern technology. She looks forward to your generosity.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Simplecia

texts.en:
Simplecia is 54 years old, married, and lives in Mantic, Tangub City. She has two children. 

She earns a living through a firewood vending business. She has been doing this business for ten years and earns PHP 4,000 a month from this work. Simplecia has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to buy more firewood to sell. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married, with five children.  She is 48 years old and resides at Calabayan, Ozamis City. 

Estrella owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been eight years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  Estrella joined GDMPC in 2007. 

In the future, Estrella wants to build a house and to finish her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr: Albert est un homme de 41 ans, marié et pére de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 13 ans et 6 mois, 3 d'entre eux vont à l'école. Il est commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale oû il tient une boutique de vêtements et de bijox depuis 10 ans déjà.La qualité de ses produits, ses prix et surtout son dynamisme lui ont valu au fil du temps une tré grande clientéle q'elle n' arrive plus à fidéliser à cause de la rupture permanente de ses stocks. Il sollicite donc ce credit pour pouvoir augmenter ses stocks en s'achetant des vêtements, des bijoux et des accéssoires téléphoniques.Il espere avec ça fidéliser sa clientéle et ainsi augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Avec ses bénéfices il voudrait réinvestir dans sa structure enfin de pouvoir s'offrir plutard d'autres boutiques.
texts.en:
Albert is a 41-year-old man, married and the father of four children, ages 13 years to 6 months.  Three of his children go to school.

Albert works as a seller in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city, where he has been running a clothing and jewelry shop for the past ten years already.

Thanks to the quality of his products, to his reasonable prices, and to his own enthusiasm, Albert has been able to build a large customer base.  However, since he is constantly out-of-stock, some of his customers are no longer faithful to his business.

This is why he is requesting this loan, in order to purchase clothes, jewelry and phone accessories, and therefore increase his stock of merchandise.  He hopes that this will help him to regain customer loyalty and and to increase his profit margin.

He would like to use his profits to reinvest in his business, and he dreams about opening new shops in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, jewelry, and phone accessories.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 44-year-old married woman. 

She is been in business of rearing goats for the past three years. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  She is supporting her family of four members.  With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to lead them to a decent life. 

She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them at higher prices while her husband sells them out in the market.

She took a loan for the betterment of her business and to increase her livestock, i.e., goats.  Now she is requesting Rs. 10,000 for the purchase of two more goats. 

She hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 62-year-old married woman and the mother of 12 grown children, from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. 

She has been in fish vending business for more than 30 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. This business provides for their daily needs, especially for the schooling of her children when they were still young.

As of this time, Rosalinda needs more capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of  PHP 6,000 to buy new fishing nets, hooks, and fuel for the fishing boat of her husband.  

With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving them more chance of selling more fish to the market.

In the market, Rosalinda hopes to make their livelihood more sustainable. She also plans to save some of their income for future use.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, hooks, and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Edwin Henry

texts.es: El Señor Edwin tiene 23 años de edad vive en el municipio de Chimoré del departamento de Cochabamba es jornalero quiere decir que su trabajo de actividad de albañilería y arreglos de construcción lo realiza en el día jornal. Edwin es una persona sencilla y siempre estuvo acostumbrado a la labor del campo, es soltero sin hijos, desde muy pequeño se dedico a trabajar ya que su familia de escasos recursos económicos y tuvo que subsistir casi sin la ayuda de sus padres, siendo joven sufrió mucho por falta de ayuda familiar y se relaciono con personas de muy poca confianza y se dedico a la bebida perdiendo siempre lo que ganaba, ahora él se renovó y al saber que se tiene que cuidar solo recapacito y trabaja arduamente para ahorra y poder comprarse algo que le pertenezca, se entero de los créditos Kiva y con muchas ganas de emprender otro ingreso de moto taxista solicita un crédito para que compre su motocicleta y así pueda tener mayores ingresos y poder ahorrar para lo que le depare el futuro.
texts.en:
Edwin, 23, is a day laborer who lives in the city of Chimoré in Cochabamba department. He does bricklaying and building repairs. Edwin is modest and is used to farm work. He is single and has no children. He has been working since childhood, as his family had few financial resources and he had to get by with almost no help from his parents.
