*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ma. Edna

texts.en:
Ma. Edna is 46 years old and lives in Caloocan, the Philippines. She is married, the mother of several children and works hard to pay for her family's everyday expenses. She earns a living by running a variety (or sari-sari) store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to people who live in her neighborhood. She buys from wholesalers, sells on a retail basis and brings in about PHP 600 in sales every day. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her goal is to expand her store so that she can give her children a good, high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Nieves Group

texts.es:
La socia Ilda tiene 46 años de edad y es viuda pero tiene tres hijos, ella es natural de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. La socia Ilda es una madre emprendedora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, champus, pan, refrescos y entre otros más. Desde hace varios años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Ilda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, cajas de fideos, tarros de leche y entre otras más. 

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “virgen de la Nieves” en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está  conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Las socias que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografia llegaron tarde a la reunion). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Ilda, age 46, is a widow with three children.  She is from the Cusco province in the Cusco department.  She is an enterprising and responsible woman who gets her family ahead.

She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, shampoo, bread, and soft drinks, among others.  She has been doing this work for several years, and it is going very well for her.  Ilda needs a loan at this time in order to buy merchandise like sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, cases of noodles, and jugs of milk, among others.

This group is comprised of neighbors and friends who make up the Virgen de la Nieves communal bank in the Cusco province of the Cusco department. This communal bank is comprised of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead.  They put forth daily effort in order to give their children a better future.  The members are grateful for the opportunity given to them, and they pledge to make their different payments punctually.  (The members who appear in the lower part of the photograph arrived late to the meeting.)

Cusco is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco in the heart of the ancient Inca city. It is characterized as a tourist zone because of its archaeological centers, its historical center, its scenery, its history and for being a charming city in the southern region of the country. Cusco is also known for its traditional festival "Inti Raymi" and because it has one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, cases of noodles, and jugs of milk, among others.

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Restituto used a previous a loan for PHP 30,000 to buy more groceries to sell to his customers. The additional income generated by the loan helped him pay for the education of his children as well as meet other personal and business expenses. He is applying for a new loan, for PHP 40,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell in his store. The more items he displays there, the better he will do and the more profit he will earn. He looks forward to receiving this new loan with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. His goals for the future are to expand his business and give his children a good education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from his religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
This is Estela, 61, a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, her business partner. She is also a mother. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Estela operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Estela dreams to have their own house through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
This is Nieva. She previously accessed a 42,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nieva dreams to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies at these meetings.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other inventory for her store

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Абдурауфу 42 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами более 20 лет он занимается купле продажей сухофруктов, а также переработкой и сушки абрикоса. Рядом дома он имеет огромный фруктовый сад, где очень много абрикосовых деревьев. Он очень упорно работает, но его доход не хватает оплатить за учебу дочери в университете. Его дочь умная и трудолюбивая девушка и с хорошими оценками окончила школу и поступила в университет. Абдурауф запрашивает кредит на сумму 7500 сомони для оплаты учебы дочери в университете. Абдурауф и его дочь ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Abdurauf is 42 years old and married with four children. To provide for his family, he has been buying and selling dried fruit and processing and drying apricots for 20 years. Abdurauf has a vast orchard with numerous apricot trees next to his house.
He works very hard, but his income is not enough to pay for his daughter's university education. His daughter is a smart and hard-working young woman, who graduated from high school with good grades and was accepted to a university.
Abdurauf has requested a loan of 7,500 Somoni to pay for his daughter's university education. He and his daughter thank you for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter’s university education

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and she manages her own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maribel oversees operations of her tricycle transportation business. She has one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the motorcycle, as well as to maintain it. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maribel dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies at these meetings. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Латофат жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Муж Латофат занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур, также он помогает своей жене. 
Латофат уже десять лет занимается животноводством. Она зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота. В основном Латофат разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она берет кредит для закупа двух коров и телят.
texts.en:
Latofat lives in Istaravshan. She is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband grows agricultural crops and also assists his wife in her work.

Latofat has been working in animal husbandry for 10 years now. She earns money by raising sheep and goats. She mainly raises these animals on the family homestead. 

Latofat is seeking a loan in order to purchase two cows and calves.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and calves.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia previously received a loan for PHP 10,000 that she used to buy fertilizer and garden supplies for her business. The money she earned as a result of securing this loan were a big help in paying for her children’s education and meeting personal, household and business expenses. She is applying for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell in her store. The more items she displays in her store, the better she will do and the more money she will earn. These profits will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and pay for her children’s education. She looks forward to getting this new loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Eufemia dreams of having a good life by working hard at her business, and faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion. 

*All CCT fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie previously received a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries to sell in her store. The additional earnings she made as a result of this loan were a big help in paying for her children’s education, and in meeting personal, household and business expenses. She is applying for another PHP 10,000 loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other items to sell. The more items displayed in the store, the better she will do and the more profit she will earn. Her goals are to meet her family’s daily needs and pay her children’s education bills. She looks forward to receiving this loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her religion. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Sr. De Huanca De Coya Group

texts.es:
La socia Janet tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es natural de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. La socia Janet es una madre emprendedora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en la ciudad de Coya de la provincia de Calca. Ya son cuatro meses que abrió el pequeño restaurante y le va muy bien gracias al trabajo que realiza. En esta oportunidad Janet requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, cajas de fideos, aceite, verduras, carnes y entre otras más. (La socia Janet esta levantando la mano en la fotografia). 

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Sr. de Huanca de Coya” en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está  conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Janet’s 29-years-old and in a common law relationship; she has two children.  She’s from Calca Province in Cusco Department.  She is an enterprising, responsible mother who supports her family.  She sells food; she has a small restaurant in the city of Coya in Calca Province.  She opened her small restaurant four months ago and does well thanks to the work she does.  On this occasion, Janet needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, boxes of noodles, oil, vegetables and meats, among others.  (Janet is raising her hand in the photo).

This group is composed of friends and neighbors who formed the “Señor de Huanca de Coya” communal bank in Calca Province, Cusco Department.  The members are people who are constantly seeking ways to get ahead and by means of their work provide a better future for their children.  As a group they are grateful for the opportunity being provided them and commit go make their various installment payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in Cusco District and Province belonging to Cusco Department in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It’s noted for being a tourist destination because of its archaeological sites, historic city center, scenery, history and for being a charming city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy stock ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
This is Kristine. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help towards their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display, and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. Kristine looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Kristine hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products for her direct-sales business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie.  She is 36 years old and a resident of Caloocan, Philippines.  She is married to Eliser and a mother.  Together with her husband, she manages the household and operates the business.  She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Margie operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Margie hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her children a good quality education through all of her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy wholesale products to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy, 56, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cecilio she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue the noperations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mercy hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies with this group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Christylyn

texts.en:
This is Christylyn. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and towards the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Christylyn would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and contribut towards the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Christylyn dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets  with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Generoso

texts.en:
This is Generoso, 35, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Cristina, his business partner, and he is a father of four children. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Generoso is a fish vendor. He buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. He buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. His store is located in a temporary fish market. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Generoso dreams of being able to give all his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish needed in his business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ariel and she is a mother to her seven children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elsie offers manicures and pedicures. She already has regular customers in her community and they just contact her when they need her. She does home service. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Elsie is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elsie hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed to provide manicures and pedicures.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda, de 37 años es una mujer sencilla, tiene 3 hijos pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Milena y Cristian a los que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 13 años. Su principal trabajo, desde hace 15 años consiste en la venta de verduras a las diversas ferias de la localidad, su negocio consiste en vender al menudeo las hortalizas que ella misma siembra, de esa manera obtiene más ganancias, “hay días en que no alcanza las verduras que siembro, ahí tengo que comprar a otros agricultores para poder vender”, comenta. Paralelo a ese trabajo, también vende ropa variada a las vecinas de su zona, quienes muy contentas siempre realizan pedidos de las prendas de vestir que desean, por lo que Teodolinda, ya tiene clientes fijos y ingresos económicos estables. Ahora desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para aumentar el stock de las prendas y poder brindar mayores descuentos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “buenos aires” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Teodolinda, invertirá el dinero en la compra de ropa variada para niños, mujeres y varones y si el dinero le alcanza comprará también varios kilos de verduras de toda variedad para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodolinda, 37, is an unassuming woman who has three children but only lives with two of them, Milena and Cristian, who she cares for in the house she inherited 13 years ago.  Her main work for the last 15 years has been selling vegetables in various local street markets.  She sells vegetables at retail that she grows herself to earn higher profits that way.  “There are days, though, when the vegetables I grow myself are insufficient and then I have to buy from other farmers to resell,” she comments.  Alongside this job, she also sells assorted clothing to local neighbors who happily place orders with her for the clothes they want.  Teodolina has regular customers and stable income.  

Now, she wants to increase her working capital and increase stock available to be able to offer larger discounts.  She belongs to the “Buenos Aires” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan.  She feels fulfilled because she gets help to progress with her business.  She, therefore, promises to be punctual with her payments; she enjoys working with her communal bank because they are all responsible, supportive people.

Teodolinda will use the money to buy varied clothes for children, women and men and if the money goes far enough she will also buy several kilos of assorted vegetables to continue with her business

loans.use: to buy clothes for children and adults.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía es natural de Chupaca, es viuda y en la actualidad vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa que heredo de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años comenzó con su tienda de comestibles, anteriormente tenía un restaurante en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, que cerró porque no le generaba ganancias. Por ello comenzó a dedicar todas sus fuerzas en la tienda que instalo en su misma casa y de donde vende productos de primera necesidad, también refrescos y gaseosas y para la mayor comodidad de sus clientes, puso una mesa con sillas para que sus clientes puedan consumir gaseosas con mayor comodidad. Se siente feliz, pues sus hijos la ayudan en la atención y también aprenden cada día del trato adecuado a los clientes, su negocio está mejorando poco a poco y se dio cuenta que es necesario implementarla y no descansará  hasta ver su tienda mejor equipada y en el futuro también vendiendo comida. “todo poco a poco, lo importante son las ganas de progresar”, menciona. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “cristo rey” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Sofía, invertirá el dinero en la compra de más mercadería en productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Sofía is from Chupaca.  She’s a widow and currently lives with two children in the house she inherited from her parents.  She opened a grocery store two years ago.  She used to have a centrally-located restaurant but she closed it because it wasn’t profitable.  Because of that she started to focus all her attention on the store she set up at home where she sells basic staples as well as beverages and soft-drinks for the greater comfort of her customers.  She feels happy because her children help her take care of customers and they also are learning every day how to properly treat customers.  Business has been improving little by little and she noted that she must stock it and won’t rest until her store is better equipped.  In the future she wants to also sell food.  “Everything is gradual; what’s important is to have want to make progress,” she mentions.

She belongs to the “Cristo Rey” (Christ the King) communal bank and this is the third MFP loan.  She feels fulfilled because she gets help from the group to progress in her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments.  In addition, she enjoys working with her communal bank because they are responsible, supportive people.  Sofía will use the money to buy more merchandise like basic staples for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic staples.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia previously requested a loan for 9,000 PHP, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings helped in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Ofelia is requesting another loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better her profits, which will help her to sustain her daily needs. 

Ofelia dreams of expanding her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dmoa Al-Ward Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dmoa Al-ward which consists of 3 women and one man who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out a loan of 270,000 YER.
Anisa is the president of this group and is located in the middle between the other two women in the photo. She is 42-year-old. She is a married woman and has adult children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a housewife and has a small house. She requires a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a TV. She hopes to renew her house.

loans.use: to buy a TV for personal use

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is  52 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Merlita operates a handicrafts business. She buys raw materials used in handicrafts making from suppliers, manufactures them into different products, and sells them per piece at a profit. Products include lanterns, lampshades, and other products of that ilk. Customers are attracted by the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are the local community.  She earns a minimum of 4,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Merlita is requesting a loan for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw materials and supplies needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Merlita hopes to expand her business and give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her manufacturing business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 44, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alfonso, an employee, and a mother to her children. She together with her husband manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a manufacturing business. She makes assorted handicraft home accessories that are mostly made of capiz shells. Her customers are neighbors in her community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3,500 in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilou hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed in her business.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, un joven padre de familia de 32 años, es natural de Chupaca, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa de su madre. Tiene experiencia como músico desde hace 6 años, toca el bajo y es guitarrista, conforma parte de una banda musical donde tocan varios géneros musicales desde lo típico folclórico hasta lo más moderno en rock y cumbia. Los contratos que recibe  dentro de su grupo es semanal por lo que siempre tiene trabajo, incluso hay ocasiones que cobran por hora, el gran sueño de William es tener su propio grupo musical y crear canciones propias, lo que sabe de música lo aprendió  por unas amistades que le enseñaron a tocar sin embargo desea tener conocimientos más profundos de música de todo tipo, pues como él dice “a los clientes le gusta escuchar de todo”. El otro negocio que tienen es la venta de animales  en la feria ganadera de su zona aprovechando que desde su niñez sus padres le enseñaron este oficio para lo cual  tiene proyectos de incrementar su capital de trabajo y su ganado. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Cristo Rey” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. William invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias ovejas para su negocio y si el dinero le alcanza podrá renovar sus instrumentos musicales.
texts.en:
William is a young family man originally from Chupaca. He is 32 years old and lives with his wife and child in his mother's house.

He has six years of experience as a musician. He plays bass and is a guitar player. He is in a local band that plays several music styles, from traditional folk to more modern rock and cumbia. His band gets weekly contracts so he always has work. There are even times when they charge by the hour. William's big dream is to start his own band and write his own songs. He learned everything he knows about music from some friends who taught him how to play. However, he would like to develop a deeper understanding of all kinds of music because, as he says, "customers like to hear all kinds of things." 

The other business they have is selling animals at the livestock market in their area, because ever since he was a child his parents taught him this trade. His projects are to increase his work capital and his number of animals. 

He belongs to the solidarity group Cristo Rey and this is his third loan with MFP. He feels fulfilled there because he gets the help he needs for his business to advance. That is why he promises to pay his installments on time. He also enjoys working with his group beacuse they are responsible and supportive people.

William will invest the money requested in the purchase of sheep for his business and, if there is enough money, to upgrade his musical instruments.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy supplies and other raw materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy supplies and other raw materials needed in her printing business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorna hopes to grow her business and dreams she will be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and other raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам парень в возрасте 28 лет. Он с юности занимается откормом и продажей скота. Также он работает строителем,в летний сезон. Но в основном его доход от продажей скота. Поэтому он хочет развивать свой бизнес и увеличить поголовье скота. Он планирует пока скот дешёвый на рынке купить пару коров и откормив до зимы, продать за хорошую цену. На данный момент у него сейчас три большие дойные коровы, которым также нужен корм, поэтому на полученный кредит Уктам хочет купить пару коров и корма для них. У него большие планы на будущее, обучить детей, улучшить условия проживания, купить необходимую бытовую технику.Уктам старается из-за всех сил чтобы достичь своей цели и заранее благодарит нашу организацию.
texts.en: Uktam is 38 years old and has been involved in raising and selling livestock since his youth.  He also works in construction during the summer, but he mainly earns his living from selling livestock.  Because of this, he wants to grow his business and increase the size of his herd.  While livestock is at a low price, he plans to buy two cows and feed them until the winter, when he will then sell them at a reasonable price.  Uktam currently owns three large dairy cows that he also needs to feed, so he is applying for a loan to buy the two cows and their feed.  His plans for the future include educating his children, improving his living situation and buying some necessary household appliances.  Uktam tries with all his might to reach his goals and he thanks our organization in advance.

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Expeditha

texts.en:
This is Expeditha. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for maintenance for their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for maintenance for her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Expedita dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her "tricycle"

loans.name: Merril

texts.es:
Merril, de 30 años es una mujer alegra. Vive en compañía de su hija Elizabeth a quien cuida junto a sus padres en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer luchadora, sola saca adelante a su hija, todo ello gracias a la siembra de diversos productos como papa, ajos y zanahoria, los cuales siembra en terrenos propios. Comenta que todas las mañanas cuida con mucho esmero de sus alimentos, los fertiliza, limpia u nutre de manera constante, “depende mucho de ello la calidad de los alimentos”, comenta. Ya en temporada de cosecha comercializa los alimentos en el mercado de la ciudad de Huancayo. Paralelo a este trabajo también se dedica a la ganadería, de donde tiene ingresos diarios. Ahora se concentra en la siembra de ajos, pues es una buena temporada para su siembra y espera poder tener buenas ganancias en el mercado. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “buenos aires” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Merril, invertirá el dinero en la compra de semilla de ajos y el pago del alquiler del tractor que volteará la tierra.
texts.en:
Merril, 30, is a very cheerful woman living with her daughter, Elizabeth, who she cares for alongside her parents in he own house.   She’s a tenacious woman who is raising her daughter alone thanks to her crops of various products like potatoes, garlic and carrots she grows on her own land.  She comments that she spends every morning caring for her food; she fertilizes, weeds and nourishes constantly.  “The quality of the foods very much depends on it,” she comments.  Once harvested, she sells them in a market in the city of Huancayo.  Parallel to this work she also raises cattle and earns daily income.  She’s now focusing on planting garlic because this is a good season for planting it and she hopes to earn good profits in the market.

She belongs to the “Buenos Aires” communal bank and this is the fifth MFP loan.  She feels fulfilled because she has help to progress in business.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  She likes working with her communal bank because they are all responsible, supportive people.

Merril will use the money to buy garlic seeds and to hire a tractor to till the soil.

loans.use: to buy garlic seeds and to hire a tractor.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos, vive en una aldea del Municipio de Intibucá, La Esperanza.
María tiene una actividad que le genera los ingresos necesarios para los gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de papa. Además estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos básicos alimenticios. Desde muy pequeña ha trabajado con su familia, hace 5 años ha logrado establecer su propia parcela.  Donde ella  vive es una zona apta para la agricultura, en este caso producción de papa. Le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo y apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Sus ventas han mejorado y también la cosecha.  Ella está solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF y a Kiva  por 10,500 Lempiras para comprar más fertilizantes y fungicidas para la siembra de otro ciclo de papa, con el propósito de mejorar el nivel de producción y obtener mejores ingresos. Su meta es tener buenos cultivos con un capital de trabajo propio y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 35, is married and has six children; she lives in a village in the municipality of Intibucá, La Esperanza.  She has an activity that generates income to cover household expenses.  She works in agriculture, specifically growing potatoes.  She also opened a small grocery store where she sells basic staples.  She’s worked with her family since she was little and five years ago started her own parcel of land.

She lives in a zone that’s apt for agriculture, in this case potato growing.  She spends most of her time at that and supports her family with household expenses.  She sells her products in the local market.  Her sales and her harvests are improving.

She’s asking for a second ODEF and KIVA loan for 10,500 Lempiras to buy more fertilizer and fungicide to start a new potato planting cycle in order to improve production and earn higher income.  Her goal is to have good crops with her own working capital and to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 10,000 PHP, for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on-hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Milagros dreams of being able to expand her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed for her business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Sra.  Maria de los Angeles nació en Ciudad Juarez, Chihuahua (Mexico) y desde los 8 años radica en la ciudad de Garcia (Municipio del Estado de Nuevo Leon) junto con sus padres, quienes le inculcaron el negocio de los juegos mecánicos, ya que ellos se dedicaban a eso y en un momento difícil tuvieron que vender los juegos que tenían. 
Maria se casa a los 24 años con el Sr. Sergio, con quien tiene 6 hijos, Rosalía, Gabriel, Sergio, Oswaldo, Rosa y Laura. Ella inicio con la venta de juguetes en mercados rodantes y hace 6 meses inició con la compra de algunos juegos mecánicos, trasladandose a las colonias para poner una pequeña feria y divertir a los niños hoy requiere el apoyo de un credito para darles mejor presencia e higiene a los juegos mecanicos y tambien surtir de juguetes para su venta en la propia feria  en que los niños de las comunidades a donde acude . Sus hijos viven con ella y con sus 12 nietos a quienes ha tenido que ayudar para sacarlos adelante. La Sra. Maria muestra mucho entusiasmo pensando en que su negocio le dará muchas sastisfacciones.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles was born in Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua (México) but for the last 8 years has been living in the city of García (a municipality in the State of Nuevo León) with her parents who taught her the business of mechanical rides since that’s what they did and at a difficult moment they went through had to sell their rides.

At the age of 24, María married Sergio and they have six children: Rosalía, Gabriel, Sergio, Oswaldo, Rosa and Laura.  She started out selling toys in various movable street fairs and six months ago started to buy some mechanical rides.  She goes from neighborhood to neighborhood setting up a small fair to entertain children.  

She needs a loan now to improve the appearance and hygiene of the mechanical rides and also to stock up on toys to sell at the fairs the children in the community attend.  Her children and her 12 grandchildren live with her and she has had to help move them forward.  María is very enthusiastic thinking that her business will give her much satisfaction.

loans.use: to refurbish the mechanical rides.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is applying for his third business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more bicycle tires, pedals, and tubes. He will use the anticipated profits to open another shop. 

He hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фариде 42 года, замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами 5 лет назад она начала свой бизнес, так как ее муж таксист и его доход не позволяет обеспечить семью. Фарида  имеет магазин, рядом с центральной  больницей,  где  торгует продовольственными и промышленными товарами. Несколько лет назад у нее была очень трудная условия жизни. Супруг внезапно заболел. Сделали операцию. После операции супруг не должен был работать два года. Она долго думала над решением семейной проблемы, надо было прокормить семью, и решила взять в аренду магазин и долг у родственников. Вначале ей было очень трудно, постепенно привыкла и научилась навыками торговли. Фарида обращается в нашу организацию второй раз. Она имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Фарида хочет расширить свой бизнес и получать больше дохода. Доход от бизнеса она хочет использовать для образования детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farida is 42 years old and is married with two children at home.  She started a business five years ago with the goal of providing for her family's needs, as her husband is a taxi driver and does not earn enough to support the family.  She has a store near the central hospital where she sells food and dry goods.  A few years ago, Farida's life took a difficult turn when her husband suddenly became ill and underwent surgery.  After the operation, her husband couldn't work for two years.  She thought long and hard about the solution to the problem of how to feed her family and decided to rent a storefront and borrow money from relatives.  At first, it was very difficult, but she gradually grew accustomed and learned the skills of her trade.  Farida is a second-time borrower with our organization.  She has a good credit history and wants to expand her business so she can increase her income.  She wants to use the proceeds from her business to educate her children.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy food and dry goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clear weeds.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Janice has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home-use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.  Janice has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Janice hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Max Anderson

texts.es:
Max es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su Madre, Max puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, todas las mañanas desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por la variedad y novedosas prendas de vestir que ofrece a sus clientes.
Max se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: pantalones, polos, chompas, casacas, entre otras prendas; de esta manera Max tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su local y casa propia para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Max, 20, is single living in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic man who very much wants to improve.  Unfortunately, he was unable to go to university but would have liked to very much.  In his free time he enjoys playing sports and sometimes cooks a delicious “Arroz con Pato” [Rice with Duck] to share with his family.

Thanks to much effort, enthusiasm and help from his mother, Max started his small clothing sales business.  He starts work very early in the morning every day.  He may work up to ten hours daily and believes he does well thanks to the good variety of stylish clothes he has on offer.

Max is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy merchandise like pants, shirts, jackets, sweaters, etc. for his business.  In this way, Max will have his business better stocked and he hopes to thus increase sales and income that will be very useful so that in the not too distant future he will be able to have a store and a house of his own to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 49 años vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chupaca. Toda su vida ha estado ligada  a las actividades agrícolas es así que cada día está dedicada al cultivo de la papa y maíz. Con mucha dedicación observa los terrenos de cultivo y verifica  la aparición de posibles plagas que pueden afectar seriamente sus cosechas y con ello sus ganancias, de esta manera le permite  tomar acciones concretas que la ayudan a  tener una buena producción y recuperación de la inversión que realizó en la época de siembra, para ahorrar en su inversión cuenta con sus propios equipos y herramientas como lo son un tractor. Desea para más adelante  aumentar su producción y comprar más terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “cristo rey” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Hilda; invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su campaña de siembra, como también en la compra de más ovejas.
texts.en:
Hilda, 49, lives with her husband and 3 children in their own house in Chupaca. Her life has always revolved around farming; every day is devoted to growing potatoes and corn. She watches the land attentively and checks for diseases that might seriously damage her harvests and, therefore, her income. By doing this, she can take specific steps to ensure good products and recoup the investments made during planting season. She uses her own tools and equipment like her tractor so that she can minimize her investment. She wants to increase production and buy more farmland in the future.

Hilda belongs to the communal bank “Cristo Rey.” This is her 8th loan cycle with MFP, an institution which she feels has helped her develop skills and grow her business. She promises to make her payments on time. She also likes working with the responsible and caring members of her group. Hilda will use the loan to buy natural fertilizers for this planting season and to buy more sheep.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and more sheep.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino, de 52 años, es una mujer trabajadora vive en compañía de su esposa Vicenta y sus hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 30 años aproximadamente. Desde más de 30 años dedicó su tiempo y esfuerzo a la agricultura principal actividad económica de la zona, comenta que desde niño comenzó a cuidar de la tierra por lo que según su propias palabras, “es lo único que sabe hacer”. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano comienza el día con el cuidado de sus animales a quienes alimenta y pasta en las grandes praderas de su pueblo, que se ubican a varias horas de distancia de su casa, por lo que llega al atardece a guardar a los animales para dormir. Durante ese día aprovecha el tiempo para cuidar de sus sembríos pues a esa actividad también se dedica Marino, “cuando los animales se encuentran maduros, comercializo los ejemplares en la feria que se realiza en la zona, los días viernes de cada semana”, comenta. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marino, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales, asimismo comprará ovejas con el resto de dinero.
texts.en:
Marino, who is 52, is a hardworking man who lives with his wife Vicenta and their children. He takes care of them in the home he inherited from his parents about thirty years ago. He has been dedicating his time and effort to farming for over thirty years. Agriculture is the main economic activity in the area. He says he started taking care of the land as a child, which is why - in his own words - it is the only thing he knows how to do. 

He starts his day tending to his animals. Very early every morning he feeds them and takes them to pasture in the vast prairies around town. This is several hours away from his home, so he gets back at dusk to put the animals away for the night. During the day he uses his time to take care of his crops, because Merino also farms. "When the animals are mature, I sell them at the market we have in the area every Friday," he says. 

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the help provided, because he will be able to continue investing in advancing his business. He also promises to pay his installments on time. Marino will invest the money requested in the purchase of balanced feed for his animals. He will also buy sheep with the rest of the money.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and sheep.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is a 29-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and young child. He has owned a mobile shop since 2009 where he puts up for sale a large quantity of mobile phones, rechargeable cards, and related accessories. In order to amplify the family’s income, his wife works in a local supermarket. In addition, during her free time, she provides beauty services to customers located in different areas and villages. Unfortunately, her overloaded work schedule is keeping her away from her child and this is very hard for her and her husband who stays out working all day long. 

That’s why Eddy is asking today for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories, with the intention of increasing his sales and therefore his income. Eddy’s only wish is to ensure good life conditions to his family and he is ready to do whatever it takes to achieve this.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Due to lack of job opportunities, Cristy decided to engage in a hog-raising business while she takes care of her two kids. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates their farmland by planting rice and some vegetables to sell. They aim to earn and save more income to build their own house and provide for the schooling of their children. She plans to raise more piglets for sale but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 17,000.00 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that, through this loan, she can be able to make an improvement in the business and hopes that someday she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is 33-year-old married man, father of one child. He has worked as a blacksmith for twelve years. Husein is a hard worker and a family loving person. Husein has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to help his brother to pay his university fees. 

Husein feels responsible for his family members, and insists in providing them with the education that he didn't get. Husein is an expert in his field, and recommended by most of his loyal customers.

He hopes to keep on improving and developing his business, to provide a good and healthy living to his family and the best education ever.

loans.use: to pay for his brother's university fees.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza es de la ciudad de Luque,  gracias a su arduo trabajo ya estan en su decimo sexto ciclo. Son mujeres que desean salir adelante y es por eso que se esfuerzan al maximo para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Angela tiene 45 años, está casada con el Sr Juan quien es Albañil de Obras, juntos tienen 5 hijos.  Angela es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, en lo que le está yendo muy bien porque su clientela ha aumentado mucho por su buen precio y porque ella siempre brinda muy buena atención a sus clientes.
La Sra Angela solicita el crédito para comprar lácteos, panificados, verduras, queso, etc. Con lo cual podrá seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo ya que su trabajo es el principal sustento de su familia y quiere seguir ayudándoles por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Esperanza is located in the city of Luque. Thanks to their hard work, the members are in their sixteenth loan cycle. These women want to succeed; therefore, they work very hard to help their families. Angela, 45, is married to Juan, a bricklayer, and they have 5 children.  Angela is a merchant who sells essential items. Her business is prospering because her customer base has increased with the low prices and great service she offers. 

Angela is requesting a loan to buy milk products, baked goods, vegetables, cheeses, etc. Then she will be able to keep giving her customers good service. She is grateful for the support she is receiving, since her business is her family's main income source and she wants to continue supporting them this way.

loans.use: to buy milk products, baked goods, vegetables, cheeses, etc.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo  con su anterior credikiva compró víveres en mayor volumen  y los vendió en el peso y la medida que solicitaron sus clientes. A él con esta inversión le fue bien, porque rotó su capital de trabajó aumentó el volumen de sus ventas y ganó por compras con descuentos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará  productos de aseo, productos como arroz, aceite, refrescos, con ello prestará en su negocio cada vez más un mejor servicio a sus clientes y además comprando en mayor cantidad ganará descuentos. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente. “Doy muchas gracias por ayudarme a sacare adelante mi negocio para mejorar mis condiciones de vida y que Dios los Bendiga. “
texts.en:
Rodrigo used his previous Kiva loan to buy foodstuffs in greater volume and sold them by the pound or in the amounts his customers needed.  He did well with this investment because he rotated his working capital and increased sales volume; he also came out ahead because he was able to get volume buying discounts.

He’s now applying for a new Kiva loan that he’ll use to buy cleaning supplies, rice, oil and soft-drinks.  By doing so, he will once again provide better customer service and by buying in larger amounts will qualify for discounts.  

His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you very much for helping me to move my business forward to improve my living conditions.  May God bless you.”

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies, rice, oil and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 36-year-old, married woman from Tiribe, Kenya.  She is the mother of five children, three of whom are in school.  Josephine works hard in her clothing sales business, which she has had for seven years.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Josephine is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to improve her business.  Specifically, she will use the loan to buy bundles of clothes and use a third of the money to pay school fees for her children. Josephine says that the loan will be very helpful in contributing to the success of her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell and pay school fees

loans.name: Zulaina's Group

texts.en:
Zulaina's Group includes seven hardworking women. Zulaina is 17 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Zulaina has been working hard to manage her small business of selling maize. 

To help expand her business, Zulaina has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize to sell and will help Zulaina to generate greater profits. This will help her parents pay the school fees for her younger siblings. 

Zulaina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Arida Clemencia

texts.es:
Arida tiene 52 años es madre soltera pero sus hijos son mayores de edad. La descendencia de Árida se dedicaban a la venta de comida tradicional y ella quiso seguir con la tradición ya que piensa que es un negocio muy bueno. En la actualidad es vendedora de ceviches -es un plato consistente en carne marinada en aliños cítricos, siendo los más comunes preparados a base de pescado, mariscos o ambos. Ahora su horario es todos los días desde la mañana con la ayuda de un hijo y otra persona. 
El tipo de negocio es la venta de ceviche (venta de plato tipico del Ecuador) y con el préstamo va a comprar insumos como pescado, cevollas, etc.Una de las dificultades puede ser la delincuencia ya que esta por todos lados.El sueño de Árida es seguir trabajando para vivir mejor piensa en ayudar a sus hijos para que no se decaigan y sigan progresando
texts.en:
Arida, 52, is a single mother but her children are all adults.  Arida’s ancestors worked selling traditional meals and she wanted to continue the tradition since she believes it’s a very good business.  She currently sells ceviche, a dish consisting of meat marinated in citrus juices.  The most common ones are made from fish, seafood or both.  Her work schedule now is every day starting in the morning; her son and another person help her.

The type of business is ceviche sales (sale of an Ecuadorean traditional dish) and she will use the loan to buy ingredients like fish, onions, etc.  One of the difficulties is crime because it’s everywhere.  Arida’s dream is to continue working in order to live better.  She intends to help her children so that they will not become discouraged and continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy fish, onions, etc.

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
Mburu is a 52 year old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Jacinta who is also a farmer. They are blessed with a five year old child. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family. 

Mburu is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mburu will use the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and water pipes for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and watering pipes.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Doña Tomasa tiene 68 años de edad, soltera por viudez, tiene 7 hijos y vive en el Progreso, Yoro junto a un hijo y dos nietos.
Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y hace año y medio estableció bien su negocio de pulpería donde vende azúcar, arroz, frijoles, dulces, churros, condimentos, refrescos, manteca, abarrotes etc. es una señora muy trabajadora de su negocio ayuda a sus hijos y nietos. Este negocio lo ha mantenido estable mediante préstamos, con ODEF lleva 11 ciclos de préstamos. El préstamo actual que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras y con este va surtir mas la pulpería de productos que le hace falta y con otra parte quiere terminar de pagar un pequeño terreno que adquirió. Su meta inmediata es terminar de pagar el terreno y mantener su negocio surtido de donde espera obtener los ingresos que sostienen su hogar.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 68, is single due to widowhood; she has seven children and she lives in El Progreso, Yoro with a son and two grandchildren.

She’s always been a merchant and a year and a half ago she started her own grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, beans, candy, snacks, condiments, soft-drinks, lard, groceries, etc.  She’s a very hardworking woman and helps her children and grandchildren by means of her business.  She has kept the business stable thanks to loans; she’s been with ODEF for 11 loan cycles.

The current loan request is for 21000 Lempiras that she will use to better stock her grocery store with the products she needs and will also use part of it to finish paying for a small piece of land she bought.  Her immediate goal is to pay off the lot and to keep her store stocked so that she can earn income to support her home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 31-year-old married man. He has only one child. He has a mini-market that serves the neighborhood he lives in, and now he wants to expand by adding more goods and products to the store. For this purpose, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to expand by adding more goods and products

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 25, married, and has two infant children. She and her husband aim to become financially stable, to build their own house, and to give their children a bright future. Arlyn works in the hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She has been in this business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of PHP 9,000 when she sells two heads on a live-weight basis.

Arlyn plans to acquire more piglets to raise, but she has inadequate capital to do so. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 38,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will enable her to carry out her plan and she hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Akpabal Group

texts.fr: Groupe de solidarité à caractère masculin, l’Association AKPABAL est localisée dans la région centrale du Togo et a pour président N’Tanki. N’Tanki est cultivateur de profession et est mariée à une ménagère. Il a quatre enfants scolarisés sur six où le premier est âgé de 32 ans et le dernier de 25 ans. N’Tanki est âgé de  53 ans et exerce comme activité la culture du maïs destinée à la vente. Il exerce cette activité depuis les années 1970 toujours dans la région centrale et se fait aider par 03 membres de sa famille et 05 employés. N’Tanki vient de découvrir WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit destiné à l’achat des outils de travail. Pour l’avenir, il espère augmenter sa superficie cultivable et construire une nouvelle maison. Les autres membres du groupe exercent comme activité la culture du maïs et espèrent aussi augmenter leurs superficies cultivables.
texts.en:
AKPABAL is an all-men solidarity group located in Togo’s central region. The group’s president is N’Tanki, a 53-year-old farmer who is married to a homemaker. They have six children aged 25 to 32, four of whom have received schooling. 

N’Tanki grows maize for sale. He has been practicing this activity in the central region since the 70s, and he has three family members and five employees to help him. 

Having recently heard of WAGES, N'Tanki is seeking his first loan to purchase farming equipment. In the long term, he plans to expand his cultivable area and build a new house. 

The other group members are also maize farmers who aim to expand their cultivable land.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.en: Froilan is a father who is involved in hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is 38 years old and has five school-age children. Due to hardship of living, he aimed to strengthen the business to earn sufficient income for their daily consumption and the allowances of their children in school. To improve the business, he is asking for an additional capital of PHP 17,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. Despite problems and calamities he encountered in life, he has a strong determination to improve the business, for he believes that his patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 25 year old Lebanese man. He’s single, living with his only one parent. He is the one responsible for managing the family’s household expenses. He works nonstop, on his own, to be able to gain a higher income. He has been working as a plumber and also installing solar systems, upon requests, seven years ago. He’s an honest man and, above all, punctual. This is what make his customers loyal to him. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added plumbing tools in addition to many solar system related items for his business. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to start his new project properly. This is how Abbas works to collect higher revenues to be able to offer his only parent a respectable way of living.

loans.use: to purchase added plumbing tools in addition to many solar system related items.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Emilia  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years.
